208896.name: The Church of Lathander
208896.description:
From the introduction:

In this adventure the [player characters] explore an old church dedicated to Lathander. [They] follow up on a several clues found in Leilon 01: The House of Luceren Gray (that adventure is not needed to run this module, however). The party explores a den of ghouls hiding in the main church, while something even more evil lurks below in the catacombs.

User summary:

For 4th - 6th level characters.

208897.name: BoxMaker
208897.description:
User Summary

You design your own game missions or take a challenge.

208898.name: VRNinja
208898.description:
VRNinja is a fast-paced virtual reality game that challenges players to dodge their way past flurries of deadly weapons as they train to become the ultimate ninja master. Set in the scenic landscapes and locales of Japan.

Source: The Game Website.

208899.name: TankYou!
208899.description:
TankYou! offers the most destructive twin-stick arena-shooting action that a game should even consider.

Source: The Game Website.

208900.name: Nighttime Guardians
208900.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game about Teddy bears who are trying to keep the Terrors of the night at bay. One person plays as the Terrors (known as the Dreamer), while the others play as the teddy bears that fight them.

208901.name: Alkisah
208901.description:
Alkisah (Eng: Once upon a time) is a game of connect the dots that could be played by 3-6 players. At each turn, a player makes a word beginning with the letter that are printed on Letter cards taken and continued the story to be answered by the next player. The game continues until one The End card open then the next player opens a new Character card. Each game consists of 3 Character cards and 3 The End cards. The game ended after all 3 The End cards opened. For each Letter card successfully taken player gets 1 point. There is a bonus round where each player puts together a word from the successfully-taken Letter cards to add points.

Alkisah does not include the hourglass in the sales package, but the player may use the hourglass that lasts approximately 1-2 minutes to limit the time each player in finding the right words. If a player is not be able to do so, then at the end of the game, minus 1 point for each letter card that is missed.

There are some Effect cards mixing together to add more joy and fun of the game.

208902.name: Coils of the Medusa (Fate)
208902.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces from a parallel dimension lure our heroes into a deadly trap!

Can they discover the secrets of Lord Minus before they are torn asunder by his deadly magicks?

This superhero adventure is for use with Fate Core

208903.name: The Priest
208903.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your Faith Shall Be Your Weapon.

Like a cleric, a priest is called to serve divine powers. But unlike a cleric, a priest enters the field of battle armed only with the divine might of her god. A priest’s connection to her deity forms the very core of her being — and through this unwavering reverence, she gains her power and her strength.

New Paths 9: Priest brings a non-battle, caster-only servant of the divine to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game! Designed by Marc Radle, this class includes:

New class features including Divine Gift, Orisons, and Sacred Bond
Two new feats, Extra Divine Gift and Powerful Channel
A new archetype: Chosen of Nature, who protects and preserves the natural world




Let clerics have their hierarchies and temples: a priest ultimately answers only to her god. It is both a freedom and a heavy burden — but with it comes great power!

208904.name: Dark Orbital
208904.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Orbital is a nasty place. The Flats and Mirrors are packed with people - humans and uplifts alike - and trapped there by cold, Hard economics. They live on the trash of the rich people living in the Rings - reusing, recycling, and repurposing that trash into their own technology. Put the punk back in Cyberpunk with Dark Orbital!

208905.name: Zero Stage
208905.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to StarCluster 4 with Zero Stage, an introductory game for StarCluster 4. You play agents of the Unifactoid Peripatetic Headline Intelligencer news agency, agents with a thirst for news and a disregard for personal safety. You cover all of Jeshen Space, a ten sun system empire belonging to the Jeshen - and their allies, the Humans.

Your characters are Human or Jeshen. You know what Humans are, and Jeshen are very humanoid indeed - tailed, hairless, hermaphroditic, semi-aquatic humanoids. They run Jeshen Space, and own the choicest Real Estate. Of course, they were here first, and they took in Humanity as refugees, and beggars should not be choosers.

At any rate, Humanity has convinced the Jeshen that they co-evolved with their servitor apecies - uplifted animals, robots, and bioroids - and they could not live without them. So, though it disgusts the Jeshen, Humans have their slaves, and Jeshen Space is crawling with secrets and conflicts!

208906.name: The Necklace (StarCluster 4)
208906.description:
From publisher blurb:

This game is now StarCluster 4 - The Neclace, with the original StarCluster 3 system completely replaced with the new StarCluster 4 system. This game is entirely self-contained - you do not need any other StarCluster 4 product to play this game.

The Necklace is the thickest part of a gas torus around a neutron star, itself a part of a close binary with a hot F-type star. The gas torus was formed when another gas giant orbiting the neutron star was slowly stripped of its enormous atmosphere. The gasses stayed in a ring, slowly orbiting the neutron star. The torus changed as life spread into it. Life begets oxygen, and oxygen begets life.

The Necklace is the inner, denser part of the gas torus, which is breathable for normal humans and earth animals. There is no hard and fast boundary - the air just gradually gets thinner and thinner. This area is about 20 thousand kilometers in diameter. The entire torus has a thickness diameter of about 2 million kilometers, and an overall diameter of 9 million kilometers.

There is room for a lot of adventures among tree-covered asteroids, and along an artificial River a billion kilometers long, with half sunk asteroids in the river as islands, and all teeming with life. The game focus is entirely dependent on what you set your Association up to do - News Agency, Insurance Adjusters, Salvage Operators, Political Henchmen... There are 100 story seeds with the game, five for each of the 20 standard Association types.

208907.name: Cold Space (StarCluster 4)
208907.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cold Space is now StarCluster 4 - Cold Space! This product now uses the StarCluster 4 system rather than its original system. This is a self-contained product - you do not need any other StarCluster 4 product to use this game.

Cold Space covers the years 1949 to 1989, after swiss scientists discovered a faster than light drive and antigravity using obscure physics principles. The Soviets quickly stole the idea, and the race for the stars was on!

The ships they flew in were crude, rough, and apt to fall apart if not tended constantly, but they worked!

The Cold War has moved into space, where the Americans, Soviets, and the rest of the nations of the world move in a political miasma of espionage, proxy wars, revolution, deceit, and betrayal.

The years 1949-1989 are a time of profound cultural change, from sock-hops to discos, from Studebakers and Kaisers to Deloreans and Z-cars, from sliderules to micro computers, from the nuclear family to extended step-families, single moms, and gay parents.

Cold Space has 50 extra-solar colonies on 23 planets and moons, as well as Mars, the moon, and other colonies in our own solar system. The older colonies grow into maturity and power, while the young colonies live in a frontier state, where the latest tech may be a liability because no one can fix it. There are revolts, insurrections, and coups, shadow wars and assassinations, and political allies with radically opposite means and ends.

The pdf includes a star file for NBOS' AstroSynthesis Program.

208908.name: FTL Now (StarCluster 4)
208908.description:
From publisher blurb:

StarCluster 4 - FTL Now is the sequel to StarCluster 4 - Cold Space. The back story begins in 1990, with the fall of the Soviet Union, and ends when you want it to.

The colonies settled in Cold Space now have to deal with the Interplanetary War on Terrorism, beginning with the horror of what happened on September 11, 2001.

The search is on for the terrorists - the American Rocket Corps poking its pointed, suspicious, space-pitted nose into everyone's business.

The dozens of micro colonies that were founded by special interest groups, corporations, and private interests have to survive with Mother Earth turning her back on them.

Things have changed a lot in 16 years. This isn't your father's Cold Space.

208909.name: StarCluster 4 Free
208909.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cluster

In the game of StarCluster, you play civilians in the cluster, of any type. You can play Troupe style, with each player having more than one character, or standard single characters. You might be actors traveling in a showboat to backward colonies, or resource extractors stealing valuable hardwoods from a virgin planet, or merchanters trading from planet to planet, or insurance adjusters investigating a rash of spaceship accidents, or detectives unravelling bizarre crimes in a seedy city flushed with neon.

Humans came to the Cluster 500 years ago in slower than light ships, fleeting an unimaginable catastrophe in their home system. Now they are the dominant species in the Cluster.

Technology is very advanced in the Cluster. Active plasteel allows devices, vehicles, and even homes to change shape as required. Shrouds allow mental control over devices. Modifications, even radical ones, can be performed before or after birth. Soul Print locks open only to you, no matter what - or whose - shape you wear. Still, most humans in the Cluster are recognizably human. The weirder offshoots tend to drift to the fringes of society.

208910.name: The Sigil System
208910.description:
From the introduction:

The Sigil System is the backbone on which all Stormforge Productions’ RPGs are and will be built. The Sigil System will give you the rules and mechanics that you can weave your story around. After all, what is a game without rules? The main objective of The Sigil System is to give you the ability to resolve conflicts in a fair and balanced way without intruding onto your story and immersion.

208911.name: Glyph
208911.description:
From the introduction:

The Sigil System is the backbone on which all Stormforge Productions’ RPGs are and will be built, and The Glyph System is The Sigil System’s smaller, quicker brother. The Glyph System can handle anything that The Sigil System can in a trimmed-down, fat-shaven, only-one-dice-needed platform.

User summary:

Glyph is a light-weight generic, universal rules mechanic intended to support any genre of gaming. It shared various concepts and some mechanics with The Sigil System, but is a full-developed and standalone system.

208912.name: The Lost Battalion: All Out Warfare
208912.description:
User Summary

A simple 2D side-scroller in which you face off against German troops in a variety of backgrounds. Three cards allow you certain bonuses while playing.

208913.description:
Promo card given out during the Kickstarter for the Dice Tower.

If another player plays a Mischief card in your room, flip this card. They must play the Mischief card into a different players' room. (you may not use this card's ability again once it is flipped. If there is no other player to choose they must play another card.)
208913.name: Garbage Day: "Shut the Door!" Promo

208914.name: White Plume Mountain Reconciled
208914.description:
From the introduction:

White Plume Mountain has always been a place of superstitious awe to the neighboring villagers. People travel many miles to gaze upon this natural wonder, though few are willing to approach it closely, since it is reputed to be the haunt of various demons and devils. The occasional disappearance of those who stray too close to it reinforces this belief.

Author's blurb:

With this adventure, I simply wanted to collate and reconcile the information presented in four different incarnations of White Plume Mountain across three editions.

User summary:

A fan-created reworking of the classic module S2: White Plume Mountain.

boardgameimplementation: The Dream to End All Dreams: World Cup Soccer
208916.description:
Description from the publisher:

Fast-play solo stat sports sim dedicated to the early years of European Soccer knockout competitions. Rulers of the Continent permits you to replay entire tournaments, with scorers, in just a few dice rolls per match.

Individual sets are available, each including the base rulebook necessary to play, for the European Champions Cup, Cup Winners Cup and UEFA Cup.

For each match, teams are rated based on the number of goals they scored and conceded in the historical tournament, and these ratings are compared to identify a column on a chart. Along with a 2d6 roll, this determines the initial number of goals scored.

Teams have a "third dice" stat ensuring that those that did well in the actual tournament have a better chance of advancing, while still allowing for shock results and giant killings. A d10 roll determines whether or not each team gets to adjust the initial goal results, with the "better" teams more often gaining this advantage.

A percentile dice roll provides the name of the scorer of each goal, again based on the historical results of the competition.

With just a handful of rolls per match, an entire Tournament can be completed, and a Champion crowned, in a single sitting.

Builds on the game engine of the designer's World Cup soccer game, Dream To End All Dreams.
208916.name: Rulers of the Continent Soccer

208920.name: Reptilian Rebellion
208920.description:
User Summary

You choose a character and shoot invaders while running up and down a vertical axis. Bullet upgrades and horizontal-axis allies can be activated along the top and bottom.

208921.name: The Tomb of the Sorcerer Thane
208921.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our first side quest takes a party of 4-6 5th level characters to a small dungeon looking for a lost child.

Comes with 3 encounters, hooks for further adventure, and a new monster.

Bandits, Mummies, Animated Armor, Combat, Undead,

208922.name: Haunted Locales
208922.description:
From publisher blurb:

10 encounters for a cemetery, crypt, or similar haunted location - Our first set of random encounters in a haunted location. Comes with 10 encounters, 30 adventure hooks, and a new spell.

AwakenedTree, Combat, Dark Priest, Fiend, Ghost, Hell Hound, Humanoid, Lich, Minotaur Skeleton, Ogre Zombie, Plant, Shadow, Skeleton, Specter, Undead, Vrock, Wraith, Zombie

208923.name: Cleric/Oracle Spells III (PRD)
208923.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level cleric/oracle spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208924.name: Cleric/Oracle Spells III (3PP)
208924.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 3rd-level cleric/oracle spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208925.name: Epic Races: Adapticons
208925.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is not an invasion. This is my people, trying to survive.
- Alpha Red

Epic Races: Adapticons emulates the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide style, specifically detailing adapticons as a playable race on par with those presented in that book. This book gives adapticons a 12 Racial Point build, alternate racial traits, favored class options, the Spybot, and the Transporter racial archetypes, as well as new feats, magic items, and vehicle rules - all for adapticons!

So, if you’ve ever wanted to play a massive, powerfully built robot that can transform into vehicles, or mechanical animals, Then Epic Races: Adapticons is for you!

208926.name: Palace of Queen Ehlissa
208926.description:
Dungeon Module B3.5

Author's introduction:

We all know the controversy surrounding Jean Wells' original orange-cover version, so there's no need to rehash it here. Suffice it to say I downloaded the original version when Wizards of the Coast made it freely available and only later picked up Tom Moldvay's revised green-cover version, so my opinion of the module was formed accordingly. The exploration of a long-abandoned ruin was far more in keeping with the style of adventure I wanted to run than the ham-fisted, fairy tale plot of the revision. Still, some of that Wells quirkiness was too far out there for my taste, and Moldvay did an admirable job of applying more consistent logic to the adventure. Thus, I resigned myself to reconciling the two versions into a single coherent whole.

User summary:

Works best with a large party of mid-level characters. Note this scenario does not require the source (original) modules for play - it is self-contained.

208927.name: Savage Races II
208927.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the release of the first bestiary, the first monster book, there have been those who asked - can I play something exotic, can I play a monster instead of a regular character?

In this release of the Monster Classes series, you have the opportunity to play as two different savage races - the centaur or minotaur! As a member of these savage races, your experience playing in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is sure to be unique and filled with unexpected situations.

This book includes two monster classes - the centaur and minotaur, along with the associated feats necessary to build interesting characters, that at the same time are true to the concept presented in the Bestiary.

208928.name: The Dungeons of Aufstrag, Umbrage Saga Part 3
208928.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aufstrag is the iron will of evil. It is a house of terror where dwell the shadows of Darkness, named the Fell Beast, Unklar, the Horned God. From that bastion he ruled the world of Aihrde for a thousand years. Those long centuries saw Aufstrag grow into an edifice like to a mountain and one filled with all the nightmares and shadows of his, nay, the world's despair.

Over three thousand feet tall and a thousand wide, it is a catacomb of unbelievable dimensions. Torn from the ruins of glorious Al Liosh, lifted on high by his very might, it stands a heap of slag, dominating the sprawling swamps that cover the ruins of the old world. Aufstrag is a tower of fortresses but so great its size, it is more like to a city than ought else. But there dwelt the Horned God for his long reign and to it came the damned and he housed them in dungeons of horror and madness. And thus men call it, more than the pit of the Horned God, or his city, or his throne, men call it Hell, and so it is.

The Dungeons of Aufstrag, Umbrage Saga Part 3 is a multi-level dungeon/city complex that is both huge and ever changing. It is designed for use for any level of play, though low-level characters may suffer a higher mortality rate than higher level. Within The Dungeons of Aufstrag you will find 5 of the 21 levels: The Bone Pit, The Horned Gods Acre, Gallery of Souls, The Red Fort and Hall of Chains.

208930.name: Umbrage Saga Fragments
208930.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Umbrage Saga takes place in the shadow of the great tree of Aufstrag. Here the struggles of man and beast, of monster or fey, play out along the trackless wastes of the Hreusen River and the Blacktooth Ridge. Adventure abounds and many stalwart souls plunge into the wilderness to pluck its wealth from the glory laden field of battle.

Umbraga Saga Fragments are a series of encounter areas from the Umbrage Saga Box. The were part of the original Blacktooth Ridge adventure but were cut for space reasons. They join the encounters presented in Return to Blacktooth Ridge and Back to Blacktooth Ridge already published. The Umbrage Fragments are those areas specifically placed in the Umbrage Saga Box set now available in hard copy and available now in PDF.

These eight encounters include: The House that Meg Built, The Ineng Tree and the Dread Mire. All areas are complete and ready to play. They can be used in the A series adventures as originally planned or they can be used in any campaign or game.

The adventures vary in level.

208933.name: Heroes of the Waves
208933.description:
From publisher blurb:

So, we are taking you all on a trip to Polynesia!

Yeah, that's right- whe you get this book you are buying a mental ticket to Polynesia!

Heroes of the Waves a source book for Polynesian Pathfinder. It is in line with our Heroes of the East (Asian source book), Dragon Tiger Ox, [Heroes of the West] (ancient Americans source book), and Odyssey (a Greek source book).

Included:

Setting and cultural notes. This section covers all you need to know, in the broad strokes, about how pre-western contact life in Polynesia functioned. It covers a lot of things (and took many hours of research). This book is very close to my heart as my wife is from New Zealand and contributed many hours of help to this book's creation. While it covers Polynesia in general (a tall order by any stretch of the imagination) it focused on Maori and Hawaiian cultures to lend context so certain areas.
Rule changes for a Polynesian game including a balance AC (sans armor) by level chart and the seafaring skill.
We also have a section dedicated to describing how to use existing material (races and classes) in a Polynesian context. This covers both Paizo and Little Red material.
The Samebito player race. I mean, who doesn't want o play a feral shark person? (This is a reprint from DTO).
The Menehune player race. This is a Polynesian specific subrace for gnomes.
The mysterious Nawao player race ("wild men"). This includes full racial write up for the Nawao wild men who are a race of semi-savage monstrous humanoids with a fear of water.
The mystic, blue-skinned, Turehu player race. They dwell in tees, fear fire, and know great secrets that no other known.
The Kahuna base class. A simple, skill-rich, divine, full caster class who can invoke tapu to restrict enemy actions. Enemies can ignore this... for a price. They are a great support caster, a decent healer, and offer a lot of options to a group though their spell list. They do not outright lack offensive spells but are not blasters by any means.
This books includes a reprinted copy of the Tataued Warrior base class from our Alternate Path Martial book.
New feats as well as the new "Broken Bone" condition and the Kapu Kuialua style of Hawaiian martial art to go with it (as well as other talents, class features, etc that relate to it).
7 new Polynesian weapons and their non-Polynesian equivalents. ("Equivalents" is a rule that allows them to count as other weapons for the purpose of class features and feats)
4 new magic items including the Surfboard of the Endless Wave and Maui’s Hook!
A dozen new deities (complete with domains, favored weapons, etc). Half dedicated to Maori deities and half to Hawaiian.

208934.name: Heroes of the West
208934.description:
From publisher blurb:

Out in the west, they say there are a thousand stories.

A few of them belong to those who make their own path. Many are tales of battle, sneaking and finding, or seeing all we’ve worked for crumbling to dust. But those who pull themselves out of the pitfalls, those who fight even a losing battle, and those who make mountains out of molehills. Those are the stories that people remember.

Included:

20 page document
Brave: A native warrior who uses honor and cunning to outdo foes.
Jaguar Warrior: A ferocious combatant who takes on their totem’s form in a furious rampage.
Painted Rider: A mounted outrider using their bond with nature to bear down on their enemies.
Conquistador: A merciless mercenary who adapts to their enemies and stifles empathy for profit.
Spirit Walker: A naturalist whose close bond with an animal gives them insight into the world around them.
Cowboy: A.K.A Vaquero, this gunslinger specializes in mounted combat and trick riding.
Mountain Man: A wilderness expert who lives by the words “desperate times call for desperate measures.”
Vigilante: A watchdog who’s been forced to watch too much bites back. The vigilante serves out justice, no matter whose clothing the villain wears.

208935.name: Pilot Brothers 2
208935.description:
The Pilot Brothers’ cat Arsenic has been kidnapped by Experimental Chef Sumo! Now the famed duo must track down Arsenic before he’s served with French fries. Per usual, this madcap detective adventure won’t be without its twists and turns, as the brothers must start by constructing a composite of the catnapper’s face with the help of a witness. Before long they’ll be slipping past ticket collectors at the railway station, driving a railroad handcar and chasing a train carrying Sumo and Arsenic. Help the Pilot Brothers cross the river – without a bridge – and solve numerous challenging puzzles to save Arsenic in this heart-pounding quest!

Source: The Publisher Website.

208936.name: Phailin
208936.description:
From the introduction:

The town of Phailin was once a large adventuring hub, but has undergone a decline in trade and population due to the reduction in the number of adventurers, due in turn to the introduction of adventuring licenses. An adventuring license is required to legally explore the surrounding ruins and dungeons; trespassing in these ruins is a jailing offense.

The land around Phailin is made up of heavily forested hills, with a number of ruins scattered through them. Phailin has a number of major points of interest that the characters can utilize.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters.

208937.name: Pilot Brothers 3: Back Side of the Earth
208937.description:
Berdichev, Spring 1958. Sensible Brother Chief and his not-so-bright assistant, Brother Colleague saw a report in papers that in Tasmania number of rare animals was greatly reduced. They decided to go there and do investigation. The main suspect is Carbofos! Help Chief and Colleague to save poor elephants!

Source: The Publisher Website.

208938.description:
The dungeons of Doomgloom are said to be treacherous, in fact, those “brave adventurers” who’ve said “Doomgloom dungeon? No problem.” have never been seen again.

No one knows what lies in Doomgloom dungeon as no one has ever returned to tell the tale but you’re about to change all that. Having trained for many years and been through many adventures you think it’s time you tackled the ultimate adventure that is Doomgloom Dungeon.

Doomgloom Dungeon is a light and quick solo 'card dungeon crawler' that will take around 10 to 15 minutes to play. You will be playing cards and rolling dice in order to beat the various Dungeon cards that appear.
208938.name: Doomgloom Dungeon

208939.name: Planet Surprise
208939.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Scratch the planet, discover the planet!

Many people often imagine what is in the universe and on alien planets. Planet Surprise is a game in which you can fulfill your dreams of exploring the universe. Perhaps you can find out what's hidden on the planet in the shape of a tennis ball, or what's in the mysterious flying box?

The game is wonderfully minimalist as each player has only one scratch card (similar to a scratch ticket). On your turn, you can land on a planet, which means that you scratch the scratching layer of one planet (with a fingernail or a coin) and look at what is hiding underneath. You will always find a point value underneath, positive or negative, and also certain surprises in the form of funny graphics. The goal is to uncover the planet with the highest score. (During ten actions, you will uncover about ten planets out of sixteen.) Each set includes different deployment of points and different jokes.

Instead of scratching, you can navigate the opponent to land on a planet of your choice, without doubt the most beautiful one of those that you discovered. Some actions will allow you to gain insight into your opponent's game so that you might know better on which planets it pays to visit and which to avoid.

Planet Surprise originated as a little brother of a much larger project, a fantasy offline/online game with scratch cards called Scratch Wars. All you need to play Planet Surprise is one scratch card for each player, but they need to be all from the same set of cards (as players need to explore the same universe).

208941.name: SHENZHEN I/O
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
208941.description:
BUILD CIRCUITS. WRITE CODE. RTFM.

Features:

Build circuits using a variety of components from different manufacturers, like microcontrollers, memory, logic gates, and LCD screens.
Write code in a compact and powerful assembly language where every instruction can be conditionally executed.
Read the manual, which includes over 30 pages of original datasheets, reference guides, and technical diagrams (included as a PDF, with a physical version available for purchase separately).
Get to know the colorful cast of characters at your new employer, 深圳龙腾科技有限公司 (Shenzhen Longteng Electronics Co., Ltd.), located in the electronics capital of the world.
Get creative! Design and test your own games and devices in the sandbox.
Engineering is hard! Take a break and play a brand-new twist on solitaire.




Source: The Publisher Website.

208942.name: The Ruined City: Mission 1
208942.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Ruined City is the first official campaign set in the world of the Runed Age. What starts off as a regular mission will take the players' characters through a story of murders, mysteries and horrors as they stay seemingly caught in the eye of the Ruined Man's storm. Not only will the players have to survive the Ruined Man, but the very city will start tearing itself apart in the fear left in his wake. It will be all the can do to survive and still finish their missions to put a well deserved coin in their pocket.

User summary:

This item is the separately published first mission (only) extracted from The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208943.name: The Runed Age: Starting Character Sheets
208943.description:
User summary:

This one-page fillable form PDF allows for rapid character generation prior to print-and-play use.

The blank form typically is distributed along with ten copies that have been configured with ten pre-generated starting characters: Alfons Meyer, Amir Uzun, Carnelia Kovachev, Enni Eriksson, Giada Romero, Jakob van Dyk, Melina Zabat, Radoslaw Astrauckas, Reyes Mata, and Roderick McKenzie.

The ten pre-generated characters were first presented in weekly releases for "Character Friday" on the publisher's site.

208945.name: Varg Lund: The Mad Magician
208945.description:
From the introduction:

Varg’s life was always very natural and very ordinary, and perhaps that is the reason why he has always searched for the supernatural and extraordinary.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208946.name: Theo Hendricks: The Misanthropic Vagrant
208946.description:
From the introduction:

Say what you will about the character of humanity, but at our core we do not enjoy harming others; and when it comes to killing, it takes a lot to push someone over that ledge. It takes hatred, jealousy, ignorance, passion... in short, it requires us to take a leave of our senses in order to take the lives of others.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208947.name: Nikolas Spiros: The Perturbed Lector
208947.description:
From the introduction:

Perhaps the most often quoted idiom in Middelburg (after “Oh gods, why did it have to come to this?”) is “It is not what you know in life that matter, but who you know”. Seeing the success the Merchant League have had over their century of existence, it is hard to argue with this sentence, but there is always an exception to every rule.

Nikolas Spiros, Doctor of Runology, is such an exception.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208948.name: Jan de Wolf: The Unlucky Constable
208948.description:
From the introduction:

At first glance, Jan ought not to have become one more unfortunate soul in this city. At first glance, Jan ought to have had it all. And that is because at first glance, Jan is a member of one of the Fresian Merchant League’s prominent Trade Families. What’s more, he had the chance to be its Patriarch and could right now have been sipping expensive Valion brandy instead of skulking around the dark alleyways of Middelburg.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208949.name: Carmen Delgado: The Managerial Marksman
208949.description:
From the introduction:

Not everyone who ends up on the somber streets of Middelburg bring with them skills from their past life that they can put to good, if nefarious, uses. However, everyone brings with them a story.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208950.name: Azraq Ivn-La-Ahad: The Azure Starlord
208950.description:
From the introduction:

There are many “nobodies” on and under the streets of Middelburg. Most of these are simply the unwanted, unneeded, unwashed masses that are so often forgotten, but there are a fair few who choose, out of fear or malice, to go unnoticed by society at large.

There is, however, only one “no one” in Middelburg, and he arrived only recently.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208951.name: Amelie Schneider: The Wrathful Nun
208951.description:
From the introduction:

Amelie, or Sister Schneider as her new found colleagues are wont to call her, often describes her life in terms of Before, During, and After.

Before, she lived a comfortable urban life in Middelburg. One of six daughters to two wealthy immigrants, her upbringing was strict, devout and, most importantly, ordered. “A place for everything and everything in its place,” her father often quoted from Progenitorist scripture.

User summary:

This character pack presents a single pre-generated character for use with The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign.

208952.name: Instant Baseball
208952.description:
This might be described as a minimalist baseball game. It consists of a single plastic-laminated sheet which includes a small baseball diamond, a scoring box, rules of play, and a remarkably detailed results table that aims to reflect the probabilities of a wide range of plays.

The playing mechanism is a regular pack of cards, and each batting player turns over cards and records the outcomes until reaching three outs for an inning.

The table shows a specific result for each card in the deck, including contingencies such as tagging up on a fly out. The 52 cards produce 7 singles, 2.6 doubles, 1 triple and 1.4 home runs (7 of hearts = HR in innings 3, 6, 7 and 9, otherwise a double). There are 3 walks and 2 errors, while the rest are outs of various kinds.

The special situations apply to the three double play cards along with the 7 of spades and 3 of diamonds, where the outcomes vary depending on combinations of runners on base.

208953.name: The Flame of Mithras
208953.description:
From the introduction:

Brought to the Empire by legionnaires returning from campaigns against the Parthians and bolstered through interaction with missionaries passing from Parthia to Thracia, The Flame of Mithras teaches a mystery cult faith which primarily venerates Mithras, and, in a lesser respect, both Ahrimanus and Sol Invictus, or the Unconquered Sun.

User summary:

Cult information including structure, special trait, and background story options.

208954.name: A Little Local Difficulty
208954.description:
From the introduction:

The characters are asked to go to a ruined tower and retrieve a mage's spellbook. The mage lies sick in a local temple after his experiments went wrong. The tower is in a perilous state and he wants his equipment back before either the tower collapses completely or undesirables raid it.

User summary:

Intended for two 1st level characters. This adventure typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing:

- A Little Local Difficulty (14-page DOC; scenario)
- Eisydor (5-page RTF; Detailed NPC)
- Gwysol (7-page RTF; Detailed NPC)
- Two GIF files (maps)

208955.name: The Caves of Zyvanna
208955.description:
From the introduction:

The [player characters] come to The Caves of Zyvanna searching for a magical wood that can be used for creating rods, wands and staves. The caves are home to many creatures, hostile to the [characters] and in some cases to each other. The only entrance to the caves is by following a river as it plunges down a sinkhole. The caves are sometimes low ceilinged and as such even moving around can be hazardous.

User summary:

For 7th - 9th leel characters.

208956.name: The End of All Hope & Return of the Crown
208956.description:
Adventures in the Hollow World - Missions 4 & 5

From the Introduction:

Having returned to the site of Haldemar and found it destroyed the [player characters] discover that the Azcans have taken the survivors to their capital city to act as sacrifices to their god. Jafidor is incensed as some of his tribespeople have been taken as well. The [characters] will have to travel first across land then across Lake Chitaloc to get to Chitaloc itself. Here they will be captured or turn up in front of the King voluntarily. Either way they will be taken to the pyramid on the Festival Of Atzanteotl and sacrificed. At the moment when a [character's] heart is about to be removed Mt. Kotlati erupts darkening the sky. This is the chance for the [characters] to escape as the Azcans rarely experience darkness outdoors. The return to the campsite is made with Azcans dogging every step.

User summary:

This item presents two adventures that are thematically and mechanically linked. Together, they form part of a longer adventure path.

208957.name: When Children Play
208957.description:
What Makes a Good Pet?

From the introduction:

When Children Play is an adventure for six characters of levels 1-3. The adventure takes place in the wilderness and can be easily placed in any campaign world and can easily be played as a random encounter. A ranger in the party would be useful in playing this adventure, though they are not necessary. This adventure is designed to be a light-hearted adventure and not too serious. As such, the [dungeon master] should expect the unusual when approaching this adventure.

208958.name: Sanaseikkailijat
208958.description:
All players are dealt the same letter cards. Players simultaneously try to find and write down as long words as possible using only the letters available. Letters are divided into two categories, red and black. Each black letter used scores two points and each red letter three points. Bonus point die rolls are awarded when players reach certain thresholds on the score track. Game is played over four rounds with increasing amount of letter cards. First round with seven cards, then eight, nine, and finally ten letter cards.

Who can find the longest word? Whose word brings most points? Young players learn spelling during the game.

Contents: board, 288 letter cards, 2 sand timers, player pawns, paper and pens, die, rules.

208959.name: Tanto Cuore: Arisa Hayakawa - Tabletop Day 2016
208959.description:
Cleaning Maid - Arisa Hayakawa

Cost of 5. Allows paying -2. If you do, select an Event card in your Private Quarters, and return it to the Town. Gain Love equal to half (round down) the Employ cost of the card you returned this way.

208960.name: Miner Wars Arena
208960.description:
Fast-paced arcade game inspired by the PC gaming classic, Tunneler, with state-of-the-art top-down view, 2.5D gameplay in a fully destructible environment, and on the edge split-screen out of the box.

Enjoy unlimited gameplay variation by adjusting arena settings, such as terrain, map size, number of AI-controlled bots, technology level...

Source: The Game Website.

208961.name: RymdResa
208961.description:
A poetic, roguelike space odyssey in a procedurally generated world

When home is no more...

Resources are sparse. The world is infinitive and unknown. The universe is lonely, open and unforgiving.

You're drifting, in a big, empty and silent space. Searching for a new home. You know a few coordinates to some random locations; but this is the only information you got.

RymdResa is a challenging and evolving space adventure, based on randomness, with some RPG elements. Abstract poetry and art are expressed throughout a lonesome and calm journey in space.

Travel through a mysterious cosmos, deep and beyond. Discover the solitude of space! Customize your ship, explore and survive in the retro stylized world of RymdResa.

Source: The Game Website.

208962.name: Domino Castle
208962.description:
Domino Castle is played on a 7 x 8 grid with standard domino tiles. The game is for two players. At the beginning in two opposite corners is one tile the 0/0 and 6/6. Tile 0/0 is the starting tile for a player and tile 6/6 for the other player. All other tiles lie face up on the table.
In your turn you choose one of the open tiles and put it at your starting tile. One side of your new tile have to fit to your starting tile. If you start with the 6/6 tile you have to choose a tile with a 6.

In the second round you can choose where you place your new tile. It is not allowed to place a tile with different numbers close together; at the corner it is ok. If it`s possible you could place a new tile in the second (or even third) level. In this case both sides of the new tile must fit with the sides of the two tiles beneath.

A player who can't move passes. The other player continues. To determine the winner, the numbers of stones in the first level are multiply with the number of stones in the second level.

208963.name: Raccoon
208963.description: A storytelling card game. Includes 55 unique cards (no duplicates) of photographed wildlife, mostly of raccoons. The game is "creative and non-competitive". Game play variations abound. For example players alternate drawing a card from the face down draw pile and place face up, and then describe the scene in a single sentence as it relates to previously drawn cards. A sequence of cards, left to right thereby tells a story. A variation has each player offer a scene description and then all players vote on the best one. Another alternative has players maintain a hand of cards and on their turn offer a card to extend the story, or all players offer one card and then vote on the best story extension with that one card added to the card sequence. Although not intended as a competitive game, it could be played where the winner is the first that runs out of cards (discarding your last card requires coming up with an ending better than any other players' story extensions), or collects the most rejected cards. A variation of "Go Fish" can be played where one player turns over a card, and then all players attempt to turn over the best matching card. The player with the best match as determined by vote takes the two matching cards, all other cards are turned back over, and that player turns over the next card to be matched.

208964.name: Spill the Beans
208964.description:
This undated dexterity game consists of a pistol that shoots wooden darts, a wooden pot and post containing 8 round wooden beads (the beans), and a target area, with 13 holes valued 5 to 25, inset in the box bottom. The pot is filled with the beans and placed on top of the post, which is inserted in a hole at the front of the target area.

The rules say players should shoot from a distance of 8-10 feet, and get three shots each. When they hit the pot, it spills the beans onto the target area. Any that fall into holes count that many points. Any that remain loose are replaced in the pot for the next shot.

Winner is the first player to accumulate 250 points. Since the maximum possible score from a single round is 100, a game will last at least three rounds.

208965.name: Buried Alive
208965.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Legendary Adventures - Buried Alive, our heroes venture into the dark, subterranean recesses of the Amethyst Massifs near the city of Moonstone, beneath the watchful eye of the dwarf Murnik Karmiir and his underlings. Murnik heads up a Chezzlukk Industries, Inc, mining operation whose official directive is to unearth new deposits of the precious stones for which the mountains are named. Though, in truth, the executives at Chezzlukk have another, secret, purpose for the operation–one which could place everyone involved at risk.

Lore. Regional information on the Sickle Commons, the city of Moonstone, and the Amethyst Massifs; details on the key personalities within Chezzlukk Industries, Inc mining camp; as well as background information that precedes the adventure's main narrative.
Plot Hooks. A suite of character backgrounds / plot hooks perfect to ground characters in the locale and draw them into the intrigue that follows.
Scenarios. Random tables and charts for determining the 'traitors' and their true 'agenda' that uses an innovative 'scenario' system for handling the early stages and ultimate resolution of each adventure.
Appendices. Rules for crafting superior weapons out of "Ravensbaine" ore. Statistical information for new adversarial creatures; including the Neo Undine, a sinister siren-like humanoid that lures miners into disused or secluded tunnels and passageways before using its control over the element of water to trap and drown them there; and Those-Who-Knock, terrifying creatures whose very mention sends a shiver down the spine of those who have borne witness to the chilling knocking sound for which they are named.
Adventuring Materials. A range of investigative quests and missions which task players with unravelling the identities of the conspirators.

208966.name: Lost Ruins
208966.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Legendary Adventures - Lost Ruins, we introduce the academic and scholarly Selbrickshire Initiative. This world-renowned historical society seeks to preserve the legacy of the past through the exploration of ancient, forgotten sites, the reclamation and cataloguing of lost treasures, and answering questions about the societies, civilisations, and events of yesteryear that have long plagued modern thinkers.

The organisation has recently uncovered the location of a religious site of tremendous historical significance that was once a centre of worship for a powerful, occult sect of the ancient Quotekhi people. An expedition to the ruins was quickly mounted, however when the adventurers aiding the Selbrickshire team of scholars and historians vanish without warning, the archaeologists have a difficult choice to make; to abandon their efforts altogether or to recruit fresh meat to discover what terrible secrets the sleeping ruins harbour.

Legendary Adventures: Lost Ruins features:

Lore. Introductions to the Vind'l Svar region, Mexacotzin Ruins, and Selbrickshire faction; as well as an exposé on two prominent Quotekhi deities, the goddess Elochtaca & her slippery brother Ixcazoh.
Alphabet. A section on the alphabet/script of the ancient Quotekhi people which could easily be lifted and used elsewhere or in homebrew campaigns.
Appendices. Statistical information for several new adversaries, including the howler monkey and howler weremonkey. New player option for the "Academic Graduate", an expansive, versatile new character background that could match most character concepts. And another new player option, the "Howler Weremonkey", a lycanthropic affliction that causes its sufferer unusual symptoms; a misfit amongst even other lycanthropes.
Adventuring Materials. Many exciting new quests aiding the Selbrickshire Initiative, including an arrival quest that tasks the players with rafting to the ruin by traversing an unpredictable waterway, using cryptology to help decipher the Quotekhi language, exploring two giant sleeping ziggurats long undisturbed, competing with kenku treasure hunters for the best loot, and a lot more besides.

208967.name: Eastern Highlands
208967.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Legendary Adventures - Eastern Highlands, we visit a remote region of the world known as the Ironhills, more specifically the small, isolated village of Netherknell, which resides high up along the eastern stretch of the hills. This industrious frontier location lies far from the sanctuary and safety of civilization, instead serving as a gateway to the wild Mól Aerie mountains beyond. In short, a place where danger and peril are omnipresent companions. However, such worrisome concerns are nothing new to the people of Netherknell, who boldly face such threats with the same stoic resolve and determination that they always have.

Within the pages of Eastern Highlands you will find:

The Ironhills Region. Information on the Ironhills region, including sections on the settlements of Berxley, Howe, Hyrstmill, Heswyn, King's Landing, and Grumheim. Plus, notes on other points-of-interest, key locations, and adventuring opportunities within the highlands.
The Village of Netherknell. An expansive gazetteer on the village of Netherknell, which includes detailed biographical information on the NPCs who live there, their businesses, society, and more.
Content, Content, Content. Eastern Highlands includes 12 amazing quests for your players to undertake. The majority of which can be easily transplanted into another setting or campaign. In addition to quests, Eastern Highlands features more than a dozen random encounter charts - enough to keep your players happy for many, many sessions.
New Rules. Though fairly light on new rules, Eastern Highlands does include original statistical information for 3 NPCs, plus a player handout that features in one of the quests.

208968.name: Arctic Tundra
208968.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Legendary Adventures: Arctic Tundra, we introduce the vast, desolate wilderness known only as the Expanse to the poor souls who live there. Eking out a difficult, modest existence in these inhospitable wastes is hard enough at the best of times, but come each winter an impenetrable blizzard renders the entire arctic shelf of the Expanse unlivable to all but the hardiest, most-resilient of creatures.

Join the Iqtoh tribe in our latest offering as they undertake their perilous and exhausting annual migration, desperately racing to keep ahead of the encroaching winter before getting devoured by sub-zero conditions and dense blizzards. Travel with the tribe as they depart the Endless White and traverse the Mammoth Hinterlands, Matsuoka's Ryse, and Shifting Sea regions before, and with a little luck, finally reaching the safety and sanctuary of Whitewhorl.

Legendary Adventures: Arctic Tundra features:

The Adventure. An open, non-linear adventure that features a central meta-plot and lots of optional/recommended quests to keep your players busy in the Expanse.
New 'arctic' equipment. Including an appropriately-themed kit that provides everything aspiring adventurers could want to mount an expedition into the Expanse or any other frigid, frosty, or frozen frontier.
Appendices. Statistical information for new non-player characters and monsters, perfect for use in colder climes.
Additional Materials. Random event, encounter, and environment charts for three huge arctic-themed regions, including unique rules that govern travel in each, and several potential adventuring-hubs along the way.

208969.name: The Road to Calemma Collection
208969.description:
From publisher blurb:

Finding adventure can be a daunting task, especially in the middle of nowhere. But as the party approaches their destination of Calemma, the mundane routine of travel explodes into an all out attack. Players are absorbed into the local drama of Calemma. What starts as random raids from outland wilderness savages, turns into a discovery of Calemma's mysterious past. Players are forced to take sides in a series of events as they try to uncover the truth about this city. Zombie hordes, vampires, and enchanted trees are just a few of the challenges that are presented within the City walls. But the greatest challenge lies within the nefarious proposition given by the City Council.

This compendium contains all 3 volumes of the Calemma dilemma and all map packs needed for game play.

208970.name: The Scarecrow
208970.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your average scarecrow is created to scare of, well, crows and maybe other animals, but what happens when you take a primal spirit or even the soul of a murderous creature and bind it to a scary sack of hay? Those who can wield such wicked magic animate scarecrows to serve as guardians and wreak fear upon those who dare to trespass their lands. Regardless of the method of your creation, as a scarecrow your primary source of energy and magic is fear. Fear is what gives you purpose, fear is what you crave and fear is what feeds you. As you level up, you will have options to increase the number of ways you instill fear in your victims, become supernaturally durable, and even gain a crow companion.

This product contains two files:

A 21 page playbook containing over 20 moves, and some weapons
Three compendium classes
And a two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

208971.name: Fee, Fly, Foe, Fund
208971.description:
A Storm King's Thunder Adventure: Avenging the Blood of a Waterdhavian

From the introduction:

Two tendays ago, cloud giants attacked the town of Nightstone, slaying many of its inhabitants including Lady Velrosa Nandar, a Waterdhavian noble and High Steward of the town. Word of Velrosa’s deaths has reached Waterdeep, and the current Nandar patriarch, Talurth Nandar, is concerned his family’s investment in the region will be compromised. He’s now looking for adventurers to investigate the area, gather information, deal with any giant threats, and report back.

User summary:

For 6th - 8th level characters.

208972.name: Raid on the Emperor's Hand (5E)
208972.description:
From publisher blurb:

With a Great Prize Comes Great Peril in this 8th-level pirate adventure!

A richly laden imperial merchant ship caught on a sandbar presents a tempting target to a crew of daring pirates. Her holds may be bursting with swag, but they are also laden with soldiers, with a cruel captain at the helm. At any moment the sails of her imperial escorts may appear on the horizon, but your scurvy scalawags have found her first. A daring assault might bring you more plunder than you've seen in a year, but many pirates greedy for gold have lingered too long over a prize they thought safe, until an enemy fleet sent them to a watery grave. Can the PCs stage a lightning raid on the immobilized ship and get away with their ill-gotten gains? Dare they risk a Raid on the Emperor’s Hand?

Raid on the Emperor's Hand is a 5E adventure for 8th level characters and is the latest in our series of pirate-themed Islands of Plunder adventures for the 5th Edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game. This adventure is easily dropped into any ocean voyage or as part of a full-fledged seafaring pirate campaign, and it can be used on its own or with the companion adventures in this series like Spices and Flesh, Tarin's Crown, and Scourge of the Steaming Isle! Grab this 26-page pirate adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

208973.name: Run for the White House
208973.description:
This is a Monopoly-style election game with some add-on trivia. Each player starts with $5.5 million and rolls dice to move around the 62-space track. A player landing on a state space may pay $20,000 times its electoral votes to win it. If he doesn't want to or can't pay, the state goes up for auction. And if the state is already owned, the player pays $10,000 times electoral votes into the Campaign Fund Treasure Chest. Any player landing on that space collects all money there.

There are three kinds of random event cards and spaces: National Election Commission, National Party Headquarters and Press Conference. Each may grant or cost money or votes, and may offer the opportunity to answer a trivia question from a Presidential Seal card. Each card has two questions, one of which is chosen and read by an opponent. Answering correctly provides benefits.

The first candidate to 270 electoral votes wins, but a player may win sooner if all opponents go broke. There is a time-limit elimination process for more than two players. After 60 minutes, there is a ballot, and the player with the lowest EV total drops out and returns his states to the banks. Further ballots are held each 15 minutes until the game is down to 2 players.

208974.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Russian Campaign, Designer Signature Edition, marks the triumphant return of our hobby’s true classic wargame designs — universally acclaimed as one of the most venerable and widely-recognized games ever published, covering the Eastern Front during World War II. Few games have received as much universal praise or have been played by so many gamers across the globe.

Consim Press has embarked on a special journey and partnership with the original game designer, John Edwards, to produce this unequivocal, beautifully-rendered, new edition that honors the elegant design approach of the original creator and pays tribute to one of the finest games ever published. Reflective that this goes far beyond a simple reprint effort, this all-new edition has been in the works for more than one year as the aim is to present the ultimate “final say” of this design as John Edwards intended.

The Designer’s Signature Edition of The Russian Campaign includes numerous rules changes by leveraging the expertise and experience of today’s leading experts and world renown players who have organized numerous TRC tournament events and online support sites. These changes reflect more than thirty years of player experience as well as outcomes from recent research. Examples of the former include additional balancing rules and providing more examples of play while examples of the latter include modifications to Archangel-based replacements and German Minor Ally restrictions. Players of earlier versions of TRC will be able to immediately play the 5th edition but the designer, publisher, and developers are steadfast in their belief that the current rules make it even easier for new players to quickly get into the game.

The end result is a perfect blend of the game’s classical, core system with key enhancements and clarifications driven by the best gaming minds in the world associated with this game who have invested literally thousands of hours over the years – in both playing and supporting the game.

GAME SYSTEM HIGHLIGHTS

Multiple Impulse Movement and Combat
Rail Movement and Rail Conversion
Sea Movement (transfers, invasions, and evacuations)
Off-board movement and encirclements
HQs and Leaders
Russian Paratroops, Partisans, Warsaw Garrison
Air Power – Stukas and Sturmoviks
Reinforcement and Replacements
Sudden Death Victory Conditions
Numerous Optional rules featuring: Strategic Movement, SS Replenishment, Russian Recovery, Industrial Evacuation, Fortress Cities, Historical Weather, Battlegroups, Artillery, Russian Artillery Barrage, Optional Worker Units, National Restrictions, Historical Naval Restrictions, Hungarian Neutrality, Competitive Bidding for Sides
Replete with Variant/Experimental Rules as published over the past 30 years, including counters




Five Game Scenarios and Full Campaign Game


THE BREAKING STORM Scenario, 5 Turns (May/June ’41 – Jan/Feb ’42)
BARBAROSSA Scenario, 10 Turns (May/June 1941 - Nov/Dec 1942)
FALL BLAU Scenario, 8 Turns (May/June 1942 – July/Aug 1943)
ZITADELLE Scenario, 6 Turns (May/June 1943 – Mar/April 1944)
BAGRATION Scenario, 7 Turns (May/June 1944 – May/June 1945)
FULL CAMPAIGN GAME, 25 Turns (May/June 1941 – May/June 1945)


GAME CONTENTS

Two full size maps, including small map overlay for Lwow Hills optional rule
Three 5/8” full-color counter sheets (both NATO and icon style counters included for AFV units)
Full color, illustrated Rules booklet
Four full color Order of Battle Displays
Three full color Scenario Set-up Cards
Four full color Player Aid Cards
Single 6-sided die
Boxed
208974.name: The Russian Campaign: Designer Signature Edition

208976.name: The Dread God Al-Khazadar
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208976.description:
Publisher Blurb:

To save a city...to save a world! The end is nigh. A shadow falls on Punjar, and panic fills the streets. This doom cannot be fought, and it cannot be outrun. Unless... From the lightless depths below the city streets, you must find the way to P'quoth, and the indifference of the fate-denying Madka. The clock is ticking. There will be no victory without sacrifice. Without the courage, cunning, and strength to face an immortal, your souls will surely fall prey to the Dread God Al-Khazadar!

208977.name: Lew Pulsipher's Doomstar
208977.description:
Doomstar, the hidden unit board game of strategy and cunning, is a new exclusive release from Large Visible Machine and legendary designer Lew Pulsipher (Britannia, Dragon Rage, Sea Kings).

Source: The Game Website.

208978.name: Super Jagua
208978.description:
Super Jagua is a classic 2D retro-style single-player platformer inspired by the greatest platformers of the 80s. Run, jump, swim, discover lots of secrets, fight brutal bosses and more in this classic NES inspired adventure.

Source: The Game Website.

208979.name: Adventurous Life VR
208979.description:
User Summary

Adventurous Life VR is a game built for the HTC Vive.

208980.name: The Castle in the Sky
208980.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's first fantasy RPG, and is ready to play in your home campaign! Bold adventurers cross paths with an ancient castle, adrift in the winds above. What they find there is a history of intrigue and warfare, with time folding and unfolding all around them. They are heroes foretold by the architect and ruler of the palace, the ancient elven wizard Kaligby. He looks to them, across time and space, to aid him in uncovering the ancient evil that has led to centuries of warfare and death. What will the characters find as they walk the history of the Castle in the Sky?

208981.name: Convoy
208981.description:
Subtitled "The Trucker's CB Radio Game", this 1976 title is a roll-and-move affair that riffs off that era's fad around Citizen's Band radio. The game takes players around a lavishly illustrated map of the United States, with occasional dead-ends and many bear traps and other distractions along the way.

The inside of the box top has an extensive glossary of "C.B. and Trucker's Lingo", and many of these terms along with nicknames for states and cities are sprinkled across the board.

The box says the game was distributed by Priority Marketing Communications, a subsidiary of National Consumer Products Inc. based in Chicago.

208982.name: Loot or Die
208982.description:
User Summary

Loot collection and item optimization.

208983.name: Eye of the Leviathan
208983.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's first fantasy RPG, and is ready to play in your home campaign! Murder! Ripples of shock pour through the wee hours of the sleepy fishing shanty of Port Scuttle. An innocent young fishmonger, beloved by the locals, has been brutally murdered in her own shop. Stunned by the grisly act, the typically hardened townsfolk turn to powerful heroes to investigate the gruesome deed. Could the fishmonger's recent discovery of a massive black pearl be a possible motive? The heroes' goal is to not only bring the perpetrator to justice, but determine the twisted purpose behind the ghastly act. Concerned townsfolk decry that the evildoer must hang for his or her despicable crime. Yet when the heroes finally track down the murderer, he is already dead by the noose, and the investigation has truly only begun. Clues hint at even darker designs, as an ancient evil stirs to reclaim a once lost malevolent relic.

208984.name: The Fallen Temple
208984.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's first fantasy RPG, and is ready to play in your home campaign! Fighting against the biting winds and relentless snow to reach the other side of the mountain range known as the Demon's Teeth, a team of adventurers passes the evenings around the campfire listening to your guide's folktales of horrific beasts, bottomless ice pits, and a forgotten temple and its corrupted priestess. And now, with temperatures dropping and a legendary beast in pursuit, these heroes must decide whether to push on or take shelter and fight against an awakened evil that demands worship or delivers death.

208985.name: Anaheim Crawl
208985.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Anaheim - where even the mighty had better duck! Join DJ Hat Trick, the League of Saturday Morning Evil, the Steampunk Ninja Rodeo Clowns, and the whole gang in the Anaheim Crawl! It's the latest in Live On Pay Per View Mayhem from the game that makes hobgoblins chew every bite 32 times... Xcrawl! This was the featured Xcrawl tournament adventure at GenCon 2015!

208986.description:
Die Rückkehr ("The Return") is a freely-downloadable legend for two heroes. This legend tells of the return of Chada and Thorn back to Andor as a prelude to Die Legenden von Andor: Die letzte Hoffnung. It is designed specifically for the heroes Chada and Thorn and two players.
You need material from Legends of Andor: The Star Shield and Legends of Andor: Journey to the North.

German description
“Die Rückkehr“ ist eine trickreiche Mini-Legende für 2 Spieler.
Sie kann als Prolog zu Die Legenden von Andor: Die letzte Hoffnung verstanden werden und spielt auf dem Andor-Spielplan.
208986.name: Die Legenden von Andor: Die Rückkehr

208987.name: The Journal of Array Design (Volume 1 - Mar 2016)
208987.description:
The Journal of Array Design
Volume 1
March 2016

The Runed Age - Middelburg

208988.name: Everything is Peachy
208988.description:
Everything is Peachy is a fast-paced roguish resource gathering game where you play as the hive mind controlling a colony of peaceful, peach fueled robots.

Your primary objective is to get to the center of the galaxy as you maneuver from planet to planet completing objectives along the way, surviving hazards, harsh planet conditions and most of all - not running out of peacholium.

On your journey you can collect modules to improve your robots, and maybe, just maybe defeat the ultimate showdown at the center of the universe.

Source: The Game Website.

208989.description:
Three new elements to be added to the game:


different strategy cards with a variant increasing maintenance costs;
Deus Ex Machina cards: one-time events at a cost of VPS;
Alternate random events
208989.name: Hands in the Sea: Kickstarter Expansion

208990.name: Miaou Moon
208990.description:
You are Captain Miaou, traveling back to your planet with a cargo full of high energy food. Hit by a meteorite, you’re ejected and your food scattered all around 5 orbiting moons.

How will you survive, lost in space?

Your only chance of survival is to grab energy food to propel yourself forward. Too few energy and you'll starve to death, too much and you'll explode! When you eat, your cat gets stronger and bigger, but deflates each time you propel. Playing with gravity when you can only bump in two directions can be tricky.
Make way through 5 moons displaying different physical properties, time your jumps accordingly and tweak your catsuit to survive!

Source: The Publisher Website.

208991.name: Canonfire! Chronicles (Issue 1 - Aug 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Gateway to Adventure: A Little Problem
Off the Beaten Path: The Wailing at White Creek
Rogues Gallery: The Oracle of Joramy
Rumours From the Tap: The Brine & Barley Inn

208992.name: Racial Profiles: The Tavi
208992.description:
From publisher blurb:

Racial Profiles presents a new playable PC race in both Pathfinder RPG and 5th Edition mechanics.

About this Book

The tavi are a mongoose-like people about the size of halflings. They are often nomadic travelers who enjoy the freedom of the open road, rarely staying long in one place. They have a wanderlust for new locales and people, partly driven by an unquenchable love of new experiences, and partly motivated by a need to find and kill their nemeses: snakes and races with strong ties to snakes.

Tavi think of their friends as their "pack" and form powerful bonds with their adventuring cohorts, often taking an measure necessary to protect their packmates.

This book includes:

The story of Rikki-tikki-tavi for those unfamiliar with the Rudyard Kibling classic.
Two pages of ecology and personality information written by Gwendolyn Kestrel.
Mechanics for creating tavi player characters in both Pathfinder and 5th Edition rule systems.
Alternate racial traits for Pathfinder tavi PCs.
Favored class options for all Pathfinder Core classes.
One racial subtype (the "Meerka") in both PFRPG and 5e rules.
4 new 5th Edition feats of interest to Tavi PCs (Alertness, Danger Sense, Fleet, and Lookout)
3 new 5th Edition spells of interest to Tavi PCs (burrow, sacred watch, and soilslip).

208993.name: Samsaran
208993.description:
From publisher blurb:

Astonishing Races: Samsaran gives the race a full-racial review and expansion, emulating the style of the “Core Races“ as detailed in books like the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide and others.

Astonishing Races: Samsaran aims to give players of the reincarnating, scholarly Samsaran immersive, world-neutral materials and support for almost any kind of play. Included are new and expanded options for alternate racial traits and subtypes, favored class options for all the base, core, hybrid, and occult classes, and 6 racial archetypes. The book also has new racial rules for samsaran equipment, feats, traits, magic items, spells and more!

So if you’ve ever wanted to play a Warring Soul Unliving Master, an Oni-Slayer with a Seasonal Staff, or just drink some Pink Lotus Flower Tea, Astonishing Races: Samsaran is the book for you!

208994.name: Path to Windy Peak
208994.description:
From publisher blurb:

TW2 – Path to Windy Peak is this week’s offering in Filbar. With their first adventure under their belts, the newfound associate Gelbo Green, needs to get his alchemist shop back in order AND find some needed supplies for his potion business. As he can’t do both he has asked the party that saved his shop if they would be interested in an ingredient search. He has offered a comfortable sum and has described the items he is need of. Will your party help the Gnome out?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Wagovian Campaign, but is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

208995.description:
Game description from the publisher:

A 300-foot lizard has just trampled the city. As a business owner, your future is clear:

REBUILD AND MAKE KAIJU SKIN HANDBAGS.

Step into the shoes of a company chairman in a land threatened by giant Kaiju. It’s up to you to turn the shattered remains of your city into profit and prosperity, but watch out for the next wave of monster attacks! Make money, construct buildings, and research products related to the war on Kaiju. Collect Victory Points to insure your company’s domination!

Can you lead your company to success and prosperity amidst the rubble and constant threat of blob attacks? Who will corner the market on Kaiju skin handbags? Find out in Kaiju Incorporated!

Kaiju Incorporated is a card drafting, economic game. Each turn players draft a building card and either pay to add it to their tableau or discard it to generate income for themselves and other players. Player’s buildings also generate research, which enables them to draft new product cards. The new product cards score victory points based on the building cards in their tableau. However, generating income can also cause the Kaiju to attack you, destroying buildings or causing other kinds of mischief.
208995.name: Kaiju Incorporated

208996.name: Bard Spells I (PRD)
208996.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level bard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

208997.name: Bard Spells I (3PP)
208997.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 1st-level bard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

208998.name: Founder's Fen
208998.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small village on the edge of a swamp - This swampy village contains 10 detailed locations, 30 adventure hooks, and 3 novelties.

208999.name: Lurian Trailing Cluster: Book 1
208999.description:
From publisher blurb:

The waters of the Deluge have receded.
We have survived.
Now, we must reclaim our birthright: the stars.

The Lurian Trailing Cluster was once a remote frontier, settled by misfits, renegades, and anyone desperate enough for a second chance on a distant world. Now, six centuries after the cataclysmic Deluge wrought untold destruction on civilization, the worlds of the Cluster are clawing their way back into space. But among the untold riches to be found in the heavens lie dangers too terrible to contemplate. Only the bravest and boldest adventurers can possibly survive the trials that await humanity in the stars.

Lurian Trailing Cluster Book 1 is a science fiction setting designed for Stars Without Number, by Sine Nomine Publishing. In this product, you will find a brief history of the Cluster, as well as summaries for all fourteen of its worlds, faction data, and star maps. Three worlds are given fully detailed write-ups, including system and planetary data, trade tables, maps, and societal histories.

209000.name: Rituals of Blood
209000.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock the Power In Your Veins

Occult rituals, from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Occult Adventures, bring magic to the masses, with lengthy and difficult to perform magical rites which can be performed even by non-spellcasters, but which come with a cost, as well as the risk for terrible backlash to occur for those who meddle in things they do not understand. Unlike traditional spells, only a handful of occult rituals made it into that book however, which begs the question of what other strange and unknowable rituals might be lurking about in obscure tomes lost to history and memory. Tomes like this one.

This book presents a collection of 10 brand new occult rituals for use in your game, all of which are thematically linked to bloodlines, blood effigies, and blood sacrifice. Presented in the guise of a fictitious tome that player characters might stumble across, the book also includes a flavorful introductory section that can be read aloud or handed out to players, and suggestions for how to incorporate the book into your game. The rituals in this book allow players (or nefarious NPCs) to:

Instill the power of a sorcerer bloodline in a character that lacks one, or empower the blood of a sorcerer or bloodrager to empower their abilities.
Wipe out entire bloodlines, slaying whole lineages with a single spell.
Create a murderous homunculus from the blood of another creature, which will stalk and slay the donor at all costs.
Create a literal rain of gore that attracts predators from miles away, and withers and blights crops in the area.
And much, much more!
