208511.name: K240
208511.description:
K240 is a real-time strategy computer game developed by Gremlin Graphics Software Ltd in 1994 for the Amiga. It is a sequel to 1991 Amiga game Utopia: The Creation of a Nation.

Story
Based in a sector of deep space called K240 in the year 2380, the game involves building space colonies on a cluster of asteroids and mining them for valuable ore, while fighting against several different races of hostile aliens with similar motives.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K240 K240]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208512.description:
Build your crypt, destroy the village, and defeat your rivals in Vampires & Villagers: The Curse of Christoph!

The Vampires have grown displeased with the villagers of Askwith’s ongoing challenges to their dominance. The Vampire Lords set out to destroy the town, while also battling each other for supremacy. You are a Vampire Lord in control of a crypt of creatures. The goal is to end the game with the most powerful crypt. The game is played in a series of rounds as rival vampires build up their forces and deplete the village. Every time the village square is emptied, the round ends and an event occurs. Many event effects are lasting; some favor the humans, while others favor the forces of darkness. The fourth time the square is cleared, Askwith is destroyed and the game is scored.

There are four character classes: Villagers, Vampire Hunters, Thralls, and Vampires, including Master Vampires, Lesser Vampires, and Turned Hunters. Players place their Vampires and Thralls in the “crypt” in front of them in order to be able to use them in play. The creatures in the crypt can be face up and active or face down, in shadows. Active creatures can directly attack the villagers, while creatures in shadows use stealth attacks. Thralls and turned hunters/slave vampires, when applicable, can also be used to defend a creature who has been targeted by a crypt attack.

Each turn, players draw 1 card and play 1 card, choosing to build up their crypts or use a hunter or strong villager to attack one of their rivals. During the next phases, players can use the skills of face-up cards and attack the village with direct attacks and stealth. Finally, crypt attacks and other residual actions from previous turns are resolved. During a crypt attack, the Hunter is supported by all of the Villagers in the square.

After the end of the fourth round, the game ends and the power value of all creatures in the crypt in front of each player are scored, along with any giant bat victory points. The player with the highest score is the reigning Vampire Lord!

Vampires and Villagers introduces an unusual semi-cooperative element. Players both attack the village in order to gain victory points and use the villagers against one another. A strong village is a useful weapon, but it can be used against you, as well. Vampires and Villagers is all about managing opposing goals – the successful player balances bringing about the end of rounds and the game quickly with strengthening their own crypt, while simultaneously preventing their opponents from doing the same. Keeping your opponents off balance as you subtly drive the flow of the game is key to victory.
208512.name: Vampires & Villagers: The Curse of Christoph

208513.name: Beast: the Primordial Storyteller's Screen
208513.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring the beautiful collage of Beast: the Primordial art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier.

208514.name: Coils of the Medusa (ICONS)
208514.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forces from a parallel dimension lure our heroes into a deadly trap!

Can they discover the secrets of Lord Minus before they are torn asunder by his deadly magicks?

This adventure is for use with ICONS Assembled Edition.

208515.name: Death Slaves of Eternity
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208515.description:
From publisher blurb:

A LEVEL 0 SWORD & SORCERY ADVENTURE BY MARZIO MUSCEDERE

It is said even the boldest of heroes cower when madness sits the throne, and in the perilous and lurid city-sate of Hazruun the Vile - its sultan is indeed mad. For when the body of his only son and heir is found purple and lifeless, strangled in a back alley drinking den - it is decreed all must pay for the crime.

Condemned for a murder you did not commit; entombed alive with the corpse of a slain prince; you are trapped in a world of blackness, with no days, no nights, no seasons, only endless existence and the maddening sound of your own screams.

But there are worse things to fear in the tomb than the dead. For deep below in the forlorn and time-forgotten halls, shadows stir, ancients speak, and things have learned to walk that ought to crawl – and lost to the ravages of dread antiquity lurks a being who’s only thought, since the beginning of time, is its ravenous desire – to feed!

Are you able to plumb the hidden mysteries of the grave, unlock its dreaded secrets and abominable lore? Do you possess the strength and courage to battle your way back into the light? Or are you doomed to spend the remainder of your pitiful lives as death-slaves of eternity…

208516.name: Treasury of the Crusade (5E)
208516.description:
From publisher blurb:

To Smite the Demon Horde!

Treasury of the Crusade brings you dozens of new 5th Edition magical items fit for a crusade, where the valorous guardians of the mortal realms stand in defiant resistance against the encroaching armies of the demon lords. They range in power from simple trinkets and tokens and magical signaling devices to mighty weapons and powerful artifacts. Some are emblematic of glorious goodness, while others reek of ineffable evil and demoniac damnation, but each one can serve to make your campaign more exciting and your treasure hoards more interesting. They add delightful detail and innovative options for heroes and villains alike, whether found as captured plunder after the sack of an enemy fortress or recovered relics of a lost outpost or expedition, or even granted as a token of esteem by the crusader commanders who keep vigilant watch upon the demon-haunted borderlands. These items range from the militant to the mundane in this book, from weapons and shields to bindings, books, and music boxes. It's true that a crusader's heart is not quite so deeply invested in treasure as a mercenary's or explorer's, but if it's a rich assortment of gear for good and bad alike they seek, they are going to love what they find in the Treasury of the Crusade.

208517.name: Nest of Nikkal
208517.description:
From publisher blurb:

FQ12 – Nest of Nikkal is this week’s Filbar offering. As the party relishes in the accolades of their achievements word of a Dragon nearby reaches their ears! Apparently a similar adventuring party stumbled upon the Wyrm by accident and was nearly wiped out. With the townspeople in fear, it is time again for the PCs to step up and perform heroic deeds! I wonder if there will be any pages from the mysterious Codex of Gamber Dauch will be around. With only one more adventure in the quest series the PCs must be getting close!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a group of upper-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

208522.description:
User Summary

208523.name: Stardust Galaxy Warriors: Stellar Climax
208523.description:
Choose your game mode, settings, mechs, weapons & upgrades to customize your experience.

Source: The Game Website.

208526.description:

Source: The Game Website.

208527.description:
n enormous Boss Tower has sprung from the ground, lifting entire towns up with it. Now, the people living on the tower are starting to contract all sorts of mysterious illnesses. Princess Remedy, still in Saturnian healing school, must use her powers to heal everyone and defeat the Boss Tower!

Source: The Developer Website.

208528.name: Batman Forever: The Arcade Game
208528.description:
Batman Forever: The Arcade Game is a beat 'em up video game based on the movie Batman Forever. The subtitle is used to differentiate it from Batman Forever, another beat 'em up published by Acclaim at around the same time. One or two players, playing as Batman and Robin, fight Two-Face, the Riddler, and numerous henchmen.
Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batman_Forever:_The_Arcade_Game," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208531.description: Issue #10 talks about new releases, prints a short story, contains some short scenario suggestions, and details a knight's manor (maps, npcs, background texts on feudalism...).

208532.name: Politicks
208532.description:
Politicks is a fun, tongue-in-cheek card game for 2–4 players featuring Maltese politicians and events from Maltese politics. Not that you need to know anything about Maltese politics or even understand Maltese to enjoy the game. The game was designed by Gordon Pace and illustrated by Mark Scicluna.

You have just been appointed as a political party’s strategist with the task of winning the upcoming election. You know that the best way to win votes is to gain the support of organisations and lobby groups by sending your best politicians to convince them and by directing the course of events to be in your favour. Will you lead your party to electoral victory?

In the game, each player represents a political party. The game is played over a number of rounds, in each of which a faction (a lobby group or organisation) is willing to meet up with the parties to decide who to support in the upcoming election. Players play politician cards to convince the faction to support them, and event cards to affect politicians and the faction. At the end of the round, the votes represented by the faction are gained by the player whose politician is most influential. The first player to gain 9 votes wins the game.

208533.name: Batman: The Animated Series – Almost Got 'Im Card Game
208533.description:
The villains of Gotham City have gathered for a poker night and to share stories about the time they nearly dispensed with that troublesome caped crusader Batman. Little do they know that the Dark Knight is in their midst, disguised as one of their own. Will the rogues be able to suss out the bat in their belfry before he clandestinely subdues them?

Batman: The Animated Series – Almost Got 'Im Card Game — a variant on the popular Werewolf-style deduction game inspired by the memorable Batman: The Animated Series episode "Almost Got 'Im" — adds a poker element to the proceedings, requiring participants to craft poker hands to activate their special abilities when the lights go out. Take on the personas of classic Batman baddies in a game in which everyone has something to hide and no one is safe.

With poker hands guiding the action, players have something to talk about. Everyone has an important role. No bystanders in this game! Too often, social deduction games begin with random accusations just to get the ball rolling. Not so here as players can request poker cards from other players and often see which cards other players are taking. Enemies are made when someone takes the card you wanted. Now you have a reason to be suspicious of another player!

Errata: The rulebook lists two Role Explanation Cards. There is only one. My mistake when I wrote the rules. ~MH

rpgpublisher: Offizielle Gesellschaft zur Erforschung von Rollenspielen (O.G.E.R.)
208538.description: Issue 3 contains plot hooks and scenarios as well as additions to the articles about poisons and herbs (cf. issue 2) as well as an article on chases in towns or cities.

208539.name: MajiMonsters Core Rulebook
208539.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The MajiMonsters Core Rulebook contains:


Information on binders, the heroes of the world
How to make a customized character
Instructions for Game Masters
A horde of magical relics to find and use
All the rules for combat and playing the game
A catalog of all 114 known MajiMonsters
Descriptions of over 440 combat techniques
Sample NPC allies and rivals
Rules for making your very own, custom MajiMonsters

208540.name: Echoes of the Lost Empire
208540.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For centuries, mankind hid in remote towns and cities scattered about the kingdom, erecting huge walls in order to protect themselves from the Monsters that lurk on the other sides.

These Monsters are the modern descendants of those once created by the ancient sorcerers known as maji. The maji dreamed of combining magic with common beasts to create a weapon that would make their rivals shrink in its shadow. They tried, and they failed; their binding ritual was weak and they could not control the Monsters that they had created—the MajiMonsters that rule the lands to this day. The maji withered and mankind retreated to their scattered, walled towns, leaving the Old Empire to fall to ruin. All that is left to it is an overgrown morass and collection of dilapidated buildings that make up the Wildlands, the present home of the much-feared Monsters.

For many, a life behind walls was all they had ever known. Travel between settlements was rare and dangerous, and those who attempted it were either incredibly brave or foolish. In those days, the only certain thing was fear.

But today is a new day.

It has been nearly two decades since Zarasul the Renewer proclaimed himself Emperor. For nearly two decades, bold men and women have taken strides at reclaiming what was lost. For nearly two decades, mankind has been afforded a new hope. Today is a day in the Age of Binders, and each new day the New Empire grows stronger.

Today, MajiMonsters are as much allies as foes. Some of the deepest bonds are forged between man and Monster. But something villainous is still at play. Something old and awful has survived to disrupt this balance. Though fallen to ruin centuries ago, echoes of the lost empire still persist to threaten mankind’s recent progress.

And where villains loom, heroes must arise.

208541.name: Drajule Altar
208541.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Each Scenes from the Wildlands encounter contains:


A full encounter description for you to use, complete with location information and read-aloud text
An area map with and without grids for print and play or use with online tabletop simulators
An area map with reference icons for the GM


User summary:

This adventure encounter, Drajule Altar, is the first in a series. It is distributed as a four-page PDF document and three supporting PNG (high resolution map) files.

208543.description:
Dwarves: Dig, Delve, Die is a fast and chaotic dice placement game. Play your worker dwarves - represented by dice - into the ever expanding mine and see what they dig up. It could be a gold mine...or a dragon.

Can you be the first player to 5 gold? The first one to do so is the winner!

Each turn you roll and place your dwarves in the mine, which is represented by a deck of cards. After you place them the dwarf that has the lowest face up value finishes work and causes something to happen based on the card he is working on.

Will it be a gold mine that earns you one gold nugget? Or maybe a dragon that eats tallest stack of dwarves? Or something else?
208543.name: Dwarves: Dig, Delve, Die

208544.name: Red Shield & Gold Eagle
208544.description:
A Roleplaying Game of the Napoleonic Wars

From the introduction:

Red Shield & Gold Eagle fills...an enormous gap in the world of roleplaying, specifically, a game which encourages adventure in the age of Napoleon. Be advised that this game is only a supplement, and not a complete game in itself. It is designed to be compatible with Swordsmen & Skeletons, Swords & Wizardry, Labyrinth Lord, other, similar clones of the Original roleplaying rules and, of course, Dungeons & Dragons (Original Edition). It is also compatible, with minor adjustments, with other editions of Dungeons and Dragons, and similar games. You will need at least one such roleplaying game to make use of Red Shield & Gold Eagle. As such, this book contains only the rules and campaign suggestions as are helpful in modifying one of the above listed rule sets for play in the Napoleonic Era. We will not give rules or descriptions on such roleplaying necessities as the use of polyhedral dice, encounter tables, descriptions of spells, magic items and equipment, except as such things are modified for this setting.

Note also that Red Shield & Gold Eagle is not a fantasy roleplaying game as such. It is more "Hollywood historical". Characters cannot fly, but sometimes make daring leaps that stretch the bounds of credulity. No magic items or spells exist, but Charlatans certainly do, and some of the things they can accomplish with their mesmeric powers is pretty amazing. Don’t despair, however, if you are a big fan of vorpal swords and rings of invisibility, I think you’ll find enough adventurous analogues to keep you happy.

[A] fantasy supplement for Red Shield & Gold Eagle [is] located in the appendix to these rules.

208545.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Dunwich Legacy is a deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

Several months ago, three Miskatonic University professors armed themselves with secret knowledge, traveled to Dunwich, and brought an end to the strange and terrifying creature that had been terrorizing the secluded village. Their heroic efforts brought peace to the region—for a while—but also left the men scarred by the horrors they had witnessed. Now, one of those professors, Dr. Armitage, has need of your assistance. His colleagues have gone missing, and he fears the worst…

With five mini cards and 156 full-size cards, The Dunwich Legacy challenges you to find the missing professors and launches you into a campaign that leads to Miskatonic University, the notorious Clover Club, and beyond. Five new investigators arrive to offer their services, armed with fifty-nine new player cards (including a complete playset of each) that allow you to pursue new deck-building strategies and new styles of play. Finally, you'll find all manner of new terrors arrayed against you—from backroom thugs and bad luck to arcane hexes and wholly unnatural abominations.
208545.name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Dunwich Legacy
boardgamefamily: Arkham Horror: The Card Game LCG

208546.name: The Indie Hack
208546.description:
(publisher blurb)

The Indie Hack (TIH) is a minimalist fantasy roleplaying game, build up from the ideas in The Black Hack, that is played with pencils, paper, dice, and imagination. It takes old-school gaming and gives it an indie edge: you get heroes, magic, traps, and monsters but the players get more control over the richness of the story.

The characters are ruled not by abstract ideas of goodness and order, but by Masters (who they try to impress) and Goddesses (who they need to appease when they are near death). The characters have relationships with each other and NPCs that mechanically evolve. Players answer class-centric questions about the world during character creation, to help the GM develop the setting and tone of the adventure.

There are seven classes to choose from: The Veteran wades through battle. The Exorcist banishes the Unliving. The Hunter can find anything in the wilderness. The Scoundrel bypasses traps and locks. The Elementalist manipulates fire, water, and stone. The Occultist summons up dead things. And The Outlander is... well... different.

In The Indie Hack, you don't collect XP, you collect scars.

208547.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac Consolidated Edition (2016)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208547.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Gongfarmer's Almanac is a Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG 'zine that is written, illustrated, edited, and produced by the DCC RPG G+ Community. The Compiled 2016 edition of The Gongfarmer's Almanac is comprised of eight separate 'zines, of varying pagecounts.

This is the compiled edition, containing all eight volumes of the 2016 Almanac.

208548.name: Playstation 2 Network Adapter
208548.description:
"Going online with PlayStation 2 requires the addition of a Network Adaptor for PlayStation 2. The Network Adaptor is a first-of-its kind connectivity device that combines a 10/100 Ethernet connection with a 56K V.90 analog modem that allows network access to a wide spectrum of consumers regardless of their in-home broadband or narrowband connectivity choice. Consumers with an in-home Internet Service Provider (ISP) account and the Network Adaptor will be able to play friends and rivals across the Internet via PlayStation 2 games specifically designed to take advantage of this capability."

publisher blurb

user summary

208549.name: Last Horizon
208549.description:
A minimal, atmospheric space survival & exploration game,
set to deep ambient music.

Pilot the last vessel of a fallen civilization
into the vast unknown in search of a new habitable world.

Explore and gather enough terraforming resources
to create a beautiful and harmonious new planet,
but take too much and you might incur the wrath of sentient alien life...

Source: The Developer Website.

208550.name: The Gongfarmer's Almanac Consolidated Edition (2015)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
208550.description:

rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
208552.description:
User summary:

Clarifications and errata for Victoriana (1st Edition). The document is color coded (clarifications in blue; errata in red) with page numbers referring to the published core book.

208553.name: Duelling Rules For Old School Role Playing Games
208553.description:
From the introduction:

The following rules are additions intended for more tactical play in D&D zero to second edition. The basic combat rules, while nicely tactical for small skirmishes, amount to little other than roll for initiative, I hack, you hack, and repeat until somebody drops from excessive blood loss.

The rules assume that dueling combat largely consists of properly exploiting openings that arise as the opponents maneuver. Aggression is useful, but must be balanced with caution and finesse, or swift death can arise from an unconsidered counter-stroke.

All standard D&D (or clone) combat rules apply except as [noted here].

208554.name: New Monsters for Swordsmen & Skeletons
208554.description:
User summary:

This concise document enumerates eighty new monsters. Each entry consists of a name, base statistics, and a one-sentence description (typically noting special abilities).

208555.name: A Swiftly Falling Empire
208555.description:
User summary:

This concise document describes the basic campaign setting for use with Swordsmen & Skeletons. After a brief introduction a regional hex map is presented. The setting would require further elaboration for a sustained campaign.

208556.name: Vigilance SuperHero d20
208556.description:
From the introduction:

Heroism. Flying through the air. Leaping tall buildings in a single bound. These are the stuff of SuperHeroic adventures. Vigilance is a d20 game designed to allow players to live this fantasy, rescuing the helpless, encouraging the meek, and standing up against the villainous. Vigilance characters are beyond mortal kin, allowing even veteran d20 players the chance to do things with their characters that they never dreamed possible. This is the world of heroes who strive to protect humanity, and the villains who seek to control the weak: A world that requires constant Vigilance from those who would protect it.

User summary:

Requires the use of Player's Handbook (D&D 3e).

208557.name: Darkness and Light
208557.description:
From the introduction:

Darkness and Light is a character sourcebook for Vigilance, SuperHero d20. Inside you will find Villains, Heroes, and those in between. Some Villains found here may yet be claimed from the darkness and brought back into the light by the intrepid hero. Included with each character are adventure hooks, along with general advice for using the characters in your campaign. Many of these characters have relationships with each other, further allowing the GM to build whole campaigns around the adventure hooks, with one character leading the players to others.

208558.name: The Complete Book of Denizens
208558.description:
From the introduction:

The "natural habitat" of the creatures in this book is Avadnu, the setting used by The Inner Circle’s Violet Dawn: The Time of the Unravelling line of products. Avadnu is a dark fantasy world suffering from the mistakes of its past, where more people are struggling to survive than attempting to rebuild. All creatures have sections describing how they fit into the world of Avadnu, and even DMs running games set elsewhere can use these sections as examples of how a given creature might fit into a world’s history.

208568.name: Keys to the Capitals
208568.description:
Game description from the publisher:

An educational game racing around the USA using the 50 Capital City Key Cards. 2-6 players start at their home towns state capital and pick from the Key Card deck to determine the prop plane route. Player picking the most key cards at end of game wins the round. Each player can check off the score pad the capital they claim. In event of tie player with their home capital wins. Ties are very rare in the 252 test games from our 2 working prototypes. Only a few. The game is very exciting and has 6 special effects that can turn the game even more exciting. Ages 7-seniors even a 4 yr old can play. Very popular with children that when they got the first prototype they play 30 times in a few week period and most rounds last 45-60 minutes average. Special effects occur 20-30 times a round when the two effects match on the dice. 2 regular dice, 2 special effect dice, 6 prop planes on stands, 50 key cards, score pad of 50 states check list. Great thing about the game is not needing to answer the questions but a memorization of the key card(s) of each state capital. It is a fun race game to collect most capitals. Object is to stay away from the long routes needed to get to the capitals. It is normal to have more than one card in your hand due to the extra key and steal a key effect.

208569.name: Shadowrift: Skittering Darkness
208569.description: This expansion to Shadowrift 2nd Edition introduces two new monster factions: the Restless Dead, featuring poltergeists; and the Cult of the Fang, featuring spiders! A Hunter hero and four new hero cards are also slated for the expansion.

208573.name: Lethal Brutal Racing
208573.description:
User Summary

Going around a track for a set number of laps, you seek to shoot your opponents and finish first. Money won can upgrade cars and weapons.

208574.name: The Eye of Judgment: Biolith Rebellion - Series 2
208574.description:
All pre-constructed decks contain 30 Summoning Cards and the Summoner's Companion - 32-pages containing tactical hints, card lists, images and stories. Booster packs consist of random summoning cards. Set/series 2 added 100 new cards to the base game.

Two-player competitive matches can be played online. As a prohibitive measure against cheating the card draw, players' summoning decks are registered and saved by the game. In online matches, the random draw is handled virtually using the registered deck data. The cards are then played as normal.

208575.name: Ranger of the Jungle
208575.description:
User Summary

This Chinese Kingdom Rush clone has some of the features of the original but lacks scale in its characters/towers as well as a speed-up feature to keep things from dragging. There are some rushed translations features which will probably be cleaned up by this reading, as hopefully will be the smoothness of the playing features.

208576.name: The Road to Calemma Vol. 1
208576.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for adventure along the vast stretch of road known to all as the Kings’ Road seemed like a marvelous type of road trip. But what started off as a good idea to several hard on their luck adventurers, turns into the most mundane wagon ride through the middle of nowhere. There are two wagons, some armed guards, and a few wagon hands and drivers. The second wagon carries a party of who-knows-what. You haven’t spoken to them at all during the trip. The only time you saw them was when everyone loaded up for the trip, and that was for a brief second. They were dressed in black robes, and haven’t come out at all during the entire journey. You figure it has to smell to high heaven in there. The wagon hands and drivers aren’t much of roadside entertainers either. Lewd, predictable jokes, and stale ale are all they have to offer as road rations are handed out for meals. The guards are well armed for some reason, and you try to figure out the amount paid for the trip, and how much it cost for the protection. Seems like someone did some bad math.

And then there is a halt in the middle of the day. Broken wagon wheel? Nope. Arrows, lots of arrows, and fire.

Seems like the middle of nowhere CAN provide some adventuring after all….

208577.name: The Road to Calemma Vol. 2: Calemma Exposed
208577.description:
From publisher blurb:

The walls of the City still smolder after the battle with the invading Savages. The battle raged into the night, and there were heavy casualties on both sides, the City at this point remains secure. It was as if the savages sent in their heaviest hitters for this one.

The following morning, the City Guard is sent scrambling to maintain their ranks and take a head count of the survivors. About half remain, and the few that made it out alive are now on double duty not only guarding the City, but rebuilding as well. Every City inhabitant at this point is beckoned to help out with the construction. The City Council warns of another attack, although they have no way of predicting this. Fear and paranoia run rampant on every street and in every home.

The PC’s are left with the internal question of where to sit in this situation. Do they move on? Or do they help rebuild? News of some gruesome activity reaches the PC’s ears the following afternoon at the Dusty Boot. It seems that when the City Guard was taking record of dead savages, several came up short. Where there was once a slain body on the ground and the remnants of their gear, it was as if the corpse just got up and walked away without a trace. This creates a rumor mill of great magnitude throughout every watering hole, adding to the already established chaos…

208578.name: The Road to Calemma Vol. 3: Split Road
208578.description:
From publisher blurb:

The City Council of Calemma had given the PC’s a final task in the last module. The council asked of them to find the K’Wathuan’s hidden village to the North, burn the buildings, slay the men, and enslave the women and children to be integrated into “City Life”. The PC’s were left with an internal question after finding out the true history of Calemma through the books shelved in Calaith’s home. This land was stolen, and its natural inhabitants displaced. Sporadic attacks from the K’Wathuans, known to the City dwellers as the “savages”, have increased in nature and more violent with every strike. The PC’s are left with the question; to destroy the remaining K’Wathuan people, or side with them and aid them in any way. (If the PC’s just throw up their hands and remain Neutral, this book is no longer needed. They will just be excused from the City permanently, and never allowed within the walls again.) But I am sure your party has made its decision.

This module is split into two parts. The first part is if the PC’s decide to follow through with the request made by the City Council. The Second half is tailored if they refuse. This module somewhat overlaps the previous when it comes to travelling North to find the hidden village. It is an extension of the last, and goes into greater detail. Either way it is really up to you, the Game Master, how you wish to use the information within this book.

There is no true linear plot line here, and never has been.

In fact, our group while playing this out, sided with the Calemmans, turned coat once the village was discovered, then acted as spies for the K’Wathuans. So there are limitless options, as with the previous modules!

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208579.name: Necromancer's Bane
208579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Necromancer's Bane can be played as a direct sequel to [The Curse of Harken Hall] but is easily played as a stand alone adventure with at least 20 hours dungeoning to be had.

The valley of Highcliff Gard has had a tradition of buring its dead in the south caverns. But guards have heard disquieting noises behind the catacomb doors of late. It may be a triffling matter though another group of gaurd have not returned from their investigations.

It's up to the party to find out what is making all this noise!

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208580.name: The Curse of Harken Hall
208580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clovis Harken, Lord of Highcliff Gard has but six months to live, at least if the family curse is anything to go by. His wife, Karlina is going frantic as he has forbidden any from investigating the curse. But he has gone on a hunting trip, and Karlina has sent word to the wayside Inn asking for investigators to explore a mysterious door hidden behind a mural in the oldest part of the manor. It's easy money if it were but a simple coal store....

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208581.name: The Tales of Highcliff Gard
208581.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tales of Highcliff Gard is an adventure setting full of building descriptions, each with their own adventure hooks, characters and their histories and at least two full dungeon adventures. Whether you have bought [The curse of Highcliff Gard] or [Necromancer's Bane] or not, The Tales of Highcliff Gard provides a rich resource for a campaign of your own making or an inspirational read for fantasy gamers of all systems.

208582.name: The Fenworthy Inheritance
208582.description:
From publisher blurb:

The holiday makers soon found their escape from the hurly burly of London to be more than a peaceful walking holiday. Little did they envision a tangled web of murder, sinister cults, ancient superstitions and a lust for revenge that has spanned generations.

Set just after the Great War in the Dartmoor famed for its Hound, MontiDots Ltd presents The fenworthy Inheritance combining detective work, intrigue and horror. Unlike many games of this type, the character just might survive!

This module introduces an adapted horror system to the basic GORE system of Goblinoid Games which uses the basic percentages skills system.

208583.name: Pie Face Showdown
208583.description: The hilarious Pie Face Showdown game brings friends and family together for lots of laugh-out-loud fun. First, players load the arm with whipped cream (not included) or the included sponge. Then each player places their chin on one of the chin rests and at the count of three, rapidly mashes the button nearest to them, which activates the hand on the throwing arm. The suspense builds as players try to get the arm to move toward their opponent and when it gets too close to the pie thrower, it'll spring up and that player will get creamed! The player who doesn't get "pie-faced" wins.

208584.name: Kridzyt
208584.description:
From the back of the book:
What is Kridzyt? The answer is simple. Kridzyt is anything that you would want it to be. Kridzyt is designed around the players and game masters making the game world and setting anything that they would want them to be. Kridzyt is a totally customizable game, using one dice and set target numbers more time can be spent on actual role-play than dice rolling. With a quick and simple character creation system and a metaphysics power system that allows your imagination to take flight.

208585.name: Kridzyt Character Booklet
208585.description:
From the publisher website:
The Character Booklet contains 1 character sheet, 2 pages of weapon cards for a total of 8 weapons, 2 pages of armor cards for a total of 4 sets of armor, more than 50 metaphysical power cards, and 2 sets of the vehicle sheets.

208586.name: Game Corp DX
208586.description:
Game Corp DX is a (video) game development management game.

Features:

Build your Game Corp from scratch and make it into the best one ever!
Start by making micro games to give your workers experience
Choose a project name, scale and genre
Expand your Studio and your team
Train your workers to use better tools
Publish your games and impress the critics
Win every award at the Annual Videogame Studio Awards!




Source: The Game Website.

208587.name: Johnny's  Boneyard
208587.description:
Every legend has a beginning and every famous skeleton like Johnny the Skull had to start somewhere. Where would that be if not at the graveyard!

To play this game the first thing you should do is find a place with dim light. We suggest going to the nearest graveyard at night to play, but we feel that might be too creepy! A darkened location is best because the skeleton bones glow in the dark.

On the count of three, both players should start excavating to become the fastest digger on earth. One player is collecting green bones and the other player orange bones. Use the shovel to move the dirt and uncover the elusive parts of our friend, Johnny. When you find a bone of your color, seize it with the eerie tweezers and put it next to the other pieces you have found on the glow in the dark diagram.

The winner of this unusual game of digging out a skeleton from a graveyard is not the one who finds all the bones first, but the one who can put all the pieces where they belong. The first player to build Johnny's skeleton will be the winner.

208588.name: Ninja Pizza Girl
208588.description:
Ninja Pizza Girl is a serious game about self-esteem, bullying and resilience – and pizza delivering ninjas!

Its deeply-woven story follows Gemma, a sixteen-year-old girl working as a pizza delivery ninja for her father’s independent Pizzeria. In a world where slums teeter on top of skyscrapers, where powerful mega-corporations exploit the poor and where quality pizza is hard to come by, Gemma must fight to keep her ideals, her family and their business intact in face of the most merciless enemies known to any teenage girl – other teenagers.

Ninja Pizza Girl. For Honour. For Family. For Pizza.

Source: The Game Website.

208589.name: Villa Musarañas Great Race
208589.description:
Villa Musarañas Great Race is going to start. Each school chooses a child to participate. What about you? Who are you going to run with?

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
Arrive at the finish line before your rivals. For this purpose you will have to overcome all kind of obstacles. First player who reaches 200 metres wins.

BOX CONTENTS
98 playing cards and 2 more cards with the rules.

CONTENTS TO PLAY
Cards, six-sided dice (take one of any other game or download an application on your smartphone browser that simulates one), notebook and pencil.

PREPARATION
The game can be played by any number of players from 2 to 6.
Write down in your notebook each one of the players in order to add the metres reached.
Divide the cards into three stacks:
1. Race (map-greens)
Overcome obstacles, dodge monsters and answer the wise men’s questions correctly to get metres in the race.
2. Equipment (open coffer-purples)
There are two kinds of objects:
Those ones that help to overcome obstacles (blues).
Those ones that are used for hindering the rest of runners (reds).
3. Runners (cup-yellows)
Each one of the runners has a physical skill (frog jump, lion strength, rabbit speed) that helps against monsters. There is also an intellectual one (language or mathematics) that helps to answer the wise men’s questions.

CARD MANAGEMENT
Shuffle the three stacks separately.
Each player chooses a runner that is put face up on the table. The discarded cards are kept.
Deal four equipment cards to each player. It is necessary to keep them out of sight. You can never have more than four equipment cards in your hand. The unused cards are put face down at one side of the table.
The race stack is put face down in the middle of the table. The race starts when putting face up the first card of the stack. When the stack has no cards left, shuffle and put face down again.

BEGINNING OF THE GAME
Roll the dice and the player with the highest score, starts playing. Each turn spins in a clockwise direction and starts showing a card of the race stack. Each card has a challenge with a score that must be overcome by rolling the dice. If you get it you get more metres or more equipment. If not, it is likely to lose metres (never under zero), equipment or the position. Each turn does not finish until each and everyone of the players try to overcome it.

STAGES IN EACH TURN
Each turn is divided into two stages:
1. Use of the equipment. You can use equipment cards only once.
2. Overcoming the challenge. In order to get it you will have to roll the dice and overcome the score of each challenge. It will be kept in mind if some equipment card has been used.
(Before starting each player’s turn, it will be also kept in mind if some equipment card has been used for hindering).

END OF THE GAME
The player who reaches 200 metres wins Villa Musarañas Great Race Cup.

208590.name: Allies & Adversaries Updated
208590.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's Old Is New Again!

From Appendix I of Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game comes the original Allies & Adversaries! The original eight sample starting Player Characters, the random bystanders and the eighteen monsters and other opponents have been updated to the Victory System, with some having their own custom Packages!

We've also filled in some of the information on the Ganymede and Nemesis Full Cyborg Conversions, the Catfish People, and the Fledgling Vampire (and Vampires in general!). Also included, more information about the mysterious "Beyond Thing" and it's terrifying minions, The Mumblers!

Sometimes, you got to save the Princess, and sometimes, she's sending you out on missions!

208591.name: Shadow World: Arena
208591.description:
Description from the publisher:

Cards and dice board game half-cooperative, based on the Shadow World universe.

Vampires, werewolves and unusual humans fight to gain control of Dark City. To achieve that they should cooperate to overcome the adversities of the environment and compete with each other in order to become the first to complete its mission. Collect a balanced band, arm them with sophisticated equipment or powerful spells and face any kind of danger. Use the other players to your advantage. Prove you're worthy of being the leader of the dark city.

MECHANICS AND TYPE OF GAME
Shadow World: Arena is a game of cards and dice, mixing the dark world of the Shadow World universe with a complete but flexible system.
In it, players will create their bands through the Character cards, Allies and Accessories. The dice are your resources, and limits what skills can use each turn the members of our band, providing a random point in the game.

Then everyone will try to accomplish the mission being assigned. To do this they will face unexpected events, and controlled by artificial intelligence enemies of the game itself and the interests of other players, because in the dark city, only one can claim victory.

208592.description:
Infusion is a sci-fi fantasy deckbuilding game featuring some of the most popular characters in all of literature. Enlist help from characters featured in stories by The Brothers Grimm, Hans Christian Anderson, Lewis Carroll, and more. Use your Recruits to complete Missions and score rewards. The player with the most reward points at the end of the game wins!


To setup, players chose a Hero card, randomly choose 12 Reinforcement Recruits, and reveal three random Epic Missions. The 12 Reinforcement Recruits and the Basic Recruit are used as a shared pool of cards available to all players. Over the course of the game, players add to their deck from this shared pool of cards.

During the game, players take turns Assigning their Recruits, Enlisting new Recruits, and Running Missions. You can enlist the help of space pirates, hackers, artificial intelligence, and more! These Recruits bring game text as well as Loyalty and Skill to a Hero, which are used to enhance your ability to enlist more Recruits and to run Missions.

Beware though - players also have Exploits at their disposal, which can alter the course of the game. You can use some Exploits to benefit yourself, while other Exploits can disrupt your opponents' turns.

The more Missions you complete, the more Reward Points you will earn. Once your Recruits raise enough Skill, you will be able to complete Epic Missions as well, for far great Rewards – such as more reward points and additional game text for your Hero. When you complete an Epic Mission, it is immediately replaced with the top card of the Epic Mission pile. Once a player has Run a total of three Epic Missions, the game ends. Everyone counts up their Reward Points to determine the winner. Whoever has the most Reward Points wins!

The base set of the game comes with 480 cards and 12 unique oversized Hero cards, which allows for lots of variety and personalized game play!

Click the following link for the rulebook! https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxVI_PqfGZR0WWNOZzZ3QUxQVDQ...
208592.name: Infusion

208595.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 77 - Sep/Oct 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Nature Red In Tooth and Claw - Move Over!
In A Store Near You: Chandlers
In A Store Near You: Everfresh Sandwiches
In A Store Near You: Light Duty Line-Throwing Tool
Raconteur's Rest: A Problem Like Myra
Raconteur's Rest: Bad Things Happen, Part 4
The Shipyard: Fram, Burke, and Foible-class Destroyers and Variants
Up Close and Personal: Cyd Annaser
Up Close and Personal: Hiram Schwartzburg
Up Close and Personal: Mark Admag
208595.description:
From the contents page

Freelance Traveller #077: Sep/Oct 2016

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

208596.name: Origins of the Society
208596.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Black Lantern Society is solely a group of people interested in charitable works and bringing art in all its forms to people throughout the land. The Rumors that it is also a secret society of spies who are following some plan are quite false...aren't they?

Do you dare find out?

Will you pass the tests and be an agent?

What follows is your induction into the society, complete with secret handshakes and magical tattoos. There could be agents anywhere - some simply gather information and pass it along, never leaving their homes or jobs. Others find creative ways to complete missions and maintain their cover lives. Yet others work solely in the shadows and live seemingly without identities of their own. Oh, you want to join? Well, you may have the eye of a seasoned agent now - who knows if they'll put your name in a hat or what form your testing will take.

Learn about the spokes of the Wheel and see what each one's speciality is. What is the overall plan? You'll find out soon. Inside this book there's everything anyone could need to create a Lantern Agent for GM's or players. There's new edges, hindrances and even some interesting magic along with a number of NPCs and a number of story threads. Plus, new secrets are revealed!

208597.name: Piercing Fortress Europa
208597.description:
Piercing Fortress Europa is a new game from veteran game designer Frank Hunter, which covers the campaigns of the Western Allies from July, 1943 through the end of April, 1945 in Sicily and Italy. Each area has its own map and time scale to best represent the campaigns for Sicily and Italy and the player is offered complete freedom, limited only by a historical order of battle and logistics model, to plan his operations and explore all of the many “what ifs” that the Italian theater has to offer.

The units of both sides are fully modelled, including armored, infantry, airborne, commando and garrison units rated for size, quality, strength and disruption. Although strength and disruption are important, the focus of the game is on supply and fuel. As the commander you need to plan ahead in this "WEGO" system, allocating your limited combat supply to your units in advance of combat operations and making sure your supply lines do not stretch too far.

Piercing Fortress Europa is not a difficult game to learn, but it is modeled with historical accuracy from start to finish to give a fast playing historical wargame that allows you to think and plan based on the same considerations as a historical theater commander.

Source: The Publisher Website.

208598.name: Bluehack
208598.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you know about The White Hack, The Red Hack, and The Black Hack, you know where this is headed. BLUEHACK is a traditional tabletop role-playing game, played with paper, pencils and dice – it uses the Holmes Basic edition of that Original 1970s Fantasy Roleplaying Game as an inspiration, but it aims to create a distinct, streamlined flavour all of its own.

208599.name: The Super Hack
208599.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Super Hack is a hyper-streamlined roleplaying game that uses the original 1970's Roleplaying Game and the wonderful THE BLACK HACK as a base. If you're looking for high octane Superhero action with a system that feels as familiar as an old glove - look no further!

The Super Hack is a fast playing game whose rules can be picked up in minutes. Character creation is superfast yet allows you to make a huge range of four colour Heroes.

You'll be amazed just how many action packed Superhero adventures you can get out of a single 20 page paperback book. Your favourite comic? Check! A multi-episode animated saga? Check! TV series? Multi-million dollar Hollywood blockbuster? Check and check again.

It's NEVER been so easy to unleash your inner Superhero!

208602.name: Super Spy Hybrid Class
208602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Become the "secret" spy that everyone knows.

Use that social status to your mission's advantage, and then employ your wide array of gadgets and outlandish Audacity to accomplish the impossible!

For Queen and Country!

The super spy is a complete 1-20 class based on the inquisitor and vigilante. Two new signature abilities, audacity and gadget expert, allow the super spy to perform eye-raising maneuvers in the face of danger.

208603.name: Perilous Oozes
208603.description:
From publisher blurb:

There’s Always Room for More Oozes!

Slimes, jellies, and oozes make for exciting and terrifying monsters, simultaneously strange and alien, with their viscous and gelatinous anatomy, and familiar, at least to anyone who’s ever had a bowl of pudding. Sadly, as fun as oozes are, they’re in relatively short supply: in the first four Pathfinder Bestiaries, there are only 25 total oozes, and only five with a CR higher than 10. This book presents a selection of five exciting new oozes, ranging from CR 4 to 20. Inside, you’ll find:

The black bubbler, a CR 20 Gargantuan ooze that can release a variety of noxious bubbles that produce supernatural effects.
The dancing death, a CR 8 Huge ooze whose spasmodic quivering causes it to act seemingly at random, and which becomes even more powerful when it splits in two.
The murder mud, a CR 4 Large ooze that can harden itself to a more solid consistency, or transmute those it grapples into statues.
The ocean gel, a CR 16 Colossal ooze which is truly massive, well beyond the size of most Colossal creatures, and can create deadly vortexes within its body.
The possession ooze, a CR 12 Medium ooze which is not only intelligent, it can dive inside the bodies of other creatures and control them from the inside.

208604.name: Legendary Vigilantes
208604.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behind the Mask

Whether you're in your secret identity or on the prowl in cape and cowl, you'll find 8 amazing archetypes between the pages of Legendary Vigilantes, perfect for bringing to life an array of classic character types from fantasy, fiction, and comics like the arsenal summoner, masked grappler, and outrageous lyricist. Add to that over 50 new vigilante talents, feats, and specialized magic items, from social and martial talents like keep 'em talking and dynamic entry, feats like Shared Identity and Vigilante Savant, and magic items like mundane glasses and the pugilist's robe. We also bring you a brand-new vigilante-focused prestige class, the scion of the city, whose connection with the city he protects brings him power even as he brings peace to the streets. Finally, we bring you the Dark Star, a fully developed 10th-level sample vigilante, complete with combat tactics and a compelling history and personality, to show how these abilities play at the table in a ready-to-use character you can drop right into an existing game or even build an entire campaign around.

208605.name: Graviteam Tactics: Sokolovo 1943
208605.description:
User summary

Sokolovo 1943 is an addon for Achtung Panzer: Operation Star, which adds new winter area of operations near the Sokolovo village and new operation for the Red Army (1st Czechoslovak Battalion) in March 1943, 15 turns.

208606.name: The House of Poe
208606.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in the swamp, villagers claim something unnatural is happening at a large manor on the edge of town. A suspicious owner whose wife died years ago is attempting something dark and terrible, and it's up to the party to stop him. The true fun of this adventure lies in the house itself, which is filled with hidden references and homages to the works of Edgar Allan Poe, with the author himself filling the role as the suspicious home owner.

User summary:

For 4th - 6th level characters.

208607.name: The Mark of Evil
208607.description:
A Resource Pack for The Things We Leave Behind

From the introduction:

The Mark of Evil is a collection of ephemera aimed at assisting Keepers in collating and organizing all the play aids from the main book and all the images therein. It will enable Keepers to print off necessary parts for their coming sessions without having to edit a page from the PDF of The Things We Leave Behind or bend the pages of their book.

Alongside this are a collection of oddities such as forms, images, and play aids that have no connection to any scenarios in the book but an enterprising Keeper may be able to craft their own scenarios from the varied and peculiar items.

208608.name: Enascentia Premade Characters
208608.description:
User summary:

This document presents five pre-generated characters for use in the game. In addition to complete statistics and a description, each character has a full-color image. Five characters are included.

208609.name: Void Racers
208609.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An invincible alien armada has laid waste to your home world, and YOU, the captain of your civilisa­tion's sole star-faring vessel, are the only being that can prevent the extinction of your once-mighty spe­cies. Pursued by an implacable enemy and hounded by the remnants of other fleeing civilisations, YOU must command your starship deep into uncharted space within the Void Nebula in search of the habita­ble planet that is rumoured to be hidden within. You must hurry : your pursuers are hot on your heels and the other species are trying to find the planet first.

rpg: Grimoire: Tales of Wizardry and Intrigue
208610.name: Grimoire: Tales of Wizardry and Intrigue
208610.description:
From the introduction:

Grimoire uses a heavily Narrative Style, where the Game Master is expected to know the game mechanics while the Players just need to figure out the ins-and-outs of spellcasting.

The Players are therefore able to keep focused on whatever terrible activity they’re currently taking part in while the Game Master does all that pesky dice-rolling in private where nobody can see and complain that rules aren’t being followed.

Ultimately the Narrative Style is about telling a story using where the participants use the in-universe rules more than anything else. Game mechanics are used until they get in the way, and from there it’s just whatever makes for the best story. There are no strict rules preventing you from trying to do whatever it is you want, so long as you can figure out how to make it happen. The Narrative Style takes to heart the belief that you should never let the rules get in the way of a good story.

rpg: Grimoire: Tales of Wizardry and Intrigue
208611.name: Grimoire: Supplement Pack
208611.description:
From the introduction:

Grimoire uses a heavily Narrative Style, where the Game Master is expected to know the game mechanics while the Players just need to figure out the ins-and-outs of spellcasting.

The Players are therefore able to keep focused on whatever terrible activity they’re currently taking part in while the Game Master does all that pesky dice-rolling in private where nobody can see and complain that rules aren’t being followed.

Ultimately the Narrative Style is about telling a story using where the participants use the in-universe rules more than anything else. Game mechanics are used until they get in the way, and from there it’s just whatever makes for the best story. There are no strict rules preventing you from trying to do whatever it is you want, so long as you can figure out how to make it happen. The Narrative Style takes to heart the belief that you should never let the rules get in the way of a good story.

208612.name: The Sorcerer
208612.description: From author's web site: "... a class for use with AD&D that summons elementals & demons and tries to force them into servitude. It's a 24 page digest-size pdf, and includes the Sorcerer class description, guidelines for summoning & binding, stats for minor elementals, details on the six demon types (Destruction, Suffering, Creation, Insanity, Ideas, and Shifting), random demon generation guidelines, and some brief suggested house rules to make AD&D feel a little more like the Michael Moorcock inspirational material. THE SORCERER should also work just fine with Swords & Wizardry, B/X D&D, Original D&D, or any of the other usual suspects."

rpg: Grimoire: Tales of Wizardry and Intrigue
208613.name: Grimoire: Wizard Generator
208613.description:
User summary:

A partially automated generator to make wizard characters is implemented as a spreadsheet - available in XLS or ODT format. The spreadsheet presents data entry cells and uses macros to generate several output (derived) values. Too, the product supports (semi) random generation for non-player characters.

208614.name: Sweet Volley High
208614.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.





Sweet Volley High – A Yuri / Otome Visual Novel from NewWestGamesSweet Volley High is the story of Aya Mizuki in her senior year at high school, as she pursues a dream of becoming a professional volleyball player. Will she find romance and success, or rejection and heartbreak? Your choices will affect the outcome in one of 5 endings.

Source: The Developer Website.

208615.name: Take Off - The Flight Simulator
208615.description:
Take Off – The Flight Simulator offers exciting missions in an open world, highly detailed planes, challenging weather conditions, astonishing views in a free flight mode and the possibility to create and manage your own airline. Everything wrapped in stunning and beautiful graphics! What are you waiting for? Start your pilot career now!

Begin your career on the beautiful Hawaiian islands and upgrade your piloting license to unlock new missions and fly new planes. Send your fleet to international airports in cities such as Los Angeles, New York, Sydney or London. Try out over a dozen realistic aircrafts with 3D cockpits – starting from light airplanes to gigantic jumbo jets that are just waiting to take to the sky! Fasten your seatbelt, extend the flaps and push the thrust lever to full throttle!

Source: The Game Website.

208616.name: Honour
208616.description:
Fron the publisher Website:
The Honour RPG is a table-top role-playing game. It is played with pencils, paper and your imagination!

Based in the fictional city Of Heung Gong (styled on our own Hong Kong) players take on the roles of seemingly ordinary citizens. These characters allow the players to delve into a world of crime, adventure and even the supernatural. The player-charaters (PCs) will confront both criminal and the lawful agents of the city, they will prevent wrongs whilst also committing crimes and at some point they will meet the Inhuman, the super-beings on whom all of humanity's myths and legends are based. In short, the players control the characters in a story of the eternal battle between law and chaos.

208617.name: La Foresta è una Somma di Alberi... o no?
rpg: La Foresta è una Somma di Alberi... o no?

208618.name: 100,000 Blind Dates
208618.description:
Chinese people are very stressed and busy due to the high cost of living. As a result, a lot of young people don't have much time to meet people and start a relationship, which leads to blind dates being a popular way to find the other half of their lives.

In many situations, young people don't know how to start to talk on a blind date, so this game is a helpful tool for them to show their charm right from the beginning.

100,000 Blind Dates is based on Chinese research on the experience of one hundred thousand blind dates. The game uses the keywords from the research to help people talking on blind dates.

The game is very easy. Players use the keyword cards and event cards in their hands, along with the charm keyword cards on the table, to profess their feelings to the people in which they're interested. Then, both people score accordingly.

At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins, and they might be the most successful mate with whom others will want to start a relationship...

208619.name: Zupper Dolls
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 69: Tuesday, September 27th
208619.description:
Zupper Dolls is a family playing game, which contain many special paper components, such as magnetic board, magnetic hero card, magnetic item card, easy to play with cute characters and drawing art, hope you and your family will like it.

It is a racing game, use difference team to fight again the boss, when processing the map, player team can get difference hero, action card and weapon,which have difference function to help player, who is the first finish the game is winner!

208620.name: SudoKount
208620.description:
SudoKount is a colorful, fun and brain challenging card game inspired by Sudoku and magical squares that renew the genre of number placement puzzle game making the experience touchable and multiplayer (both competitive or cooperative). It's also educative, decorative, and it can be brought everywhere...

SudoKount is very simple to play: draw a puzzle card and then use number tiles to solve it. Puzzle cards indicates an initial configuration for 5x5, 6x6 or 7x7 grids. Solving the puzzle consist in adding or removing number tiles so that the sum of each row and each column is equal to the goal indicated on the puzzle card.

208621.name: Sparkle 3
208621.description:
User Summary

This evolutionary gene mutation version in the Sparkle series is dominated by surreal neon graphics. You guide your organism through 12 levels, building strengths and weaknesses through eating materials or completing quests, to face bosses.

208622.name: 7 Sign Circle
208622.description:
Pulled from the lore of Evorstrom, the fictional setting of Living Empires and Living Starship, and the oracular deck of signs cards that was part of life for the sign-marked denizens of that planet comes a quick-paced, basic card game of hand management and rummy-like set collection.

The game has 121 cards of 11 Signs (suits) with 11 cards of each Sign. The object of the game is to have the highest score at the end of 7 games. The eleven signs are: Bone, Blood, Star, Wave, Wind, Tone, Stone, Flame, Spirit, Dream, and Tree.

Each round of a game players take turns playing cards from hand to the table where there are seven spaces, each marked with a random token of one of the eleven signs. You score points by collecting sets of three or more cards (3 of a kind, straights or flushes - to use poker terms). If any of the cards in a set you collect have the same sign as the space from which you took it you get bonus points. When a player reaches 77 points or more the game ends and the board is refreshed and players draw new hands of 5 cards. 7 games are played and the person with the highest score at the end of 7 games wins.

208623.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are spanners in the works which may help (or hinder) you..

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
208623.name: Rodrigues & Mauritius (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

208624.description: Alternate art promo card. The English print became available at Pokémon Trading Card Game leagues as a Non Holofoil card on January 8, 2000. A Holofoil Mew card, with the same artwork, became available in April 2000.
208624.name: Pokémon Trading Card Game: Mew Wizards Promo 8

208625.name: Thennla: A Campaign World
208625.description:
From the introduction:

Thennla is explored in two sourcebooks: Shores of Korantia and The Taskan Empire, each providing more detail on two of the great empires of the world.

This sourcebook extracts information from these supplements to give prospective players and Games Masters an introduction to Thennla before delving into greater details. It concentrates on the continent of Taygus, home to the Taskan and Korantine cultures.

208626.name: Something Smells Fishy
208626.description:
From the introduction:

A classic murder mystery! Batches of fish are going missing, a dead body is found on the town wharf and the local Commerce Guild Master needs the case investigated and the culprit apprehended, but who did it? The Chandler? The Fishmonger? The Fish Factory Manager? That will be for our heroes to discover!

User summary:

For 2nd - 4th level characters. Typically distributed as a PDF document and five JPG files (four maps and one graphic cover).

208628.name: Races for Gothic Heroes and Villains
208628.description:
User summary:

Presents five races designed to yield a "gothic" tone to any fantasy campaign. Includes Angel, Devil, Vampire, Wolf Men, and Doppleganger races. Although the sourcebook is targeted at the Ravenloft campaign setting, the materials could easily be used with any setting to yield a "gothic" element.

208629.name: Fate & Fortune
208629.description:
From the introduction:

During a game of Fate & Fortune, players will take on the roles of accidental or intentional adventurers who frequently find themselves under-equipped to handle the situations they find themselves in. Depending on the genre, these adventurers could include a group of teenagers braving a haunted house, a group of treasure-hunters in a race for a powerful, ancient artifact, or a handful of investigators looking into a cult surrounding the revival of a forgotten god-like creatures.

208630.name: Battle Academy - Fortress Metz
208630.description:
In Battle Academy: Fortress Metz you play the forces of the US 3rd Army as it tries to encircle Metz and cause the city to capitulate. Ten missions based on historical situations will test your skills as a commander. From the early attacks of the newly created, but raw, Panzer Brigades to the desperate attempts by the US infantry and engineers to take the forts, Battle Academy: Fortress Metz offers the player a wide diversity of missions. Will you be able to use your forces correctly to crack the Metz defenses while trying to fight off assaults of Panthers and German assault forces? Find out in Battle Academy: Fortress Metz!

Source: The Publisher Website.

208631.name: Abomination Realm
208631.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.






From the Kickstarter page:

Uncover the hidden world of monstrous villains - and heroes! Shunned and feared by mankind they lurk just out of sight, undermining (or defending) the civilization which despises them. Face the followers of Sthenno and her monster-lord allies, side with Mother Enyo and her frightful paladins, or play an entire campaign as monstrous heroes - upholding the light from out of the darkness!

208632.name: Amigdala
208632.description:
STORY
Gherman Driven, a middle-aged man, fanatical conspiracy theorist, who has abandoned all joy of his life. Family, friends, work. Gherman remained without anything because of his obsession with the "Philadelphia experiment," which led him to neglect every other aspect of his life. 11 years after the events of the alleged experiment, Gherman found a document that marked the coordinates of the military establishment in which all involved in the project were taken. After spending all the savings of a lifetime for trip to Greenland, certainly he did not expect to find so much...

GAMEPLAY
A story-driven horror where the goal is to find out what lies behind the experiment. All that you have is a flashlight, a lighter, and your intelligence to solve various environmental puzzles, escape from unpleasant situations and hide from what you find.

VR SUPPORT
This game was developed to be played perfectly in virtual reality. Each menu, object, or text, will be implemented in the game to allow who will use the Head Mounted Display to have a realistic effect. All you have to do to activate this mode, it's open the game menu and activate "VRMode" in the "Graphic Settings".

Source: The Developer Website.

208633.name: Campaign HQ's Guide to Villains and Vigilantes
208633.description:
From the introduction:

Campaign Headquarters [was] a World Wide Web site dedicated to providing a variety of resources to game masters of Villains and Vigilantes Second Edition, and the more recent Rules Upgrade...Much of the material presented here is generic enough to be used not only with these rules, but with the rules for Champions, Gurps: Super, Heroes Unlimited and most other superhero-based role-playing games.

208635.name: Dungeon Defenders II
208635.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




The Old Ones’ armies have invaded and it’s up to your and your friends to push them back! Create a team of heroes to defend the Eternia Crystals. Then jump into the action yourself to finish them off! Level up, collect loot, and more on your quest to defeat the Old Ones and save Etheria. Play by yourself or with up to three friends in 4-player online co-op.

As you explore Etheria you’ll find the ground littered with valuable relics, armor, and deadly weapons. Combine their stats and passives together to create your own unique hero builds. Then fuse together the pieces you don’t need to level up and enhance your favorite items.

Equip Skill Spheres to further customize your Heroes’ defenses, abilities, and stats. Small and medium Skill Spheres allow you to boost the stats on your heroes. Large Skill Spheres will grant you customized attributes and skills. Uber Skill Spheres will completely change the way your defenses or abilities work.

There are hundreds of pets just waiting to be discovered in Etheria. After hatching your new companion, you can level them up by taking them into battle! With the right evolution materials your pets can finally reach their true potential, gaining higher stats and activatable abilities that can wreak havoc on your foes.

Source: The Game Website.

208637.name: BATTLESLOTHS
videogamehonor: 2017 PAX Curse Award Repeat Offender Winner
208637.description:
Battlesloths is the fast-paced multiplayer competitive twin-stick shooter of your slothy dreams. Compete with up to 4 human players or play against AI sloths should you be short of friends. Use a myriad of weaponry, each with their own strategies, to destroy your enemies in a quest to collect the most pizza.

With 12 unique weapons, 7 game modes, customizable battle settings, team vs. options, free for all, a nuke and more hats than you can fit on 50 sloths heads; you’ll have plenty to do as you train to become the ultimate gun-toting, hoverboarding, pizza eating sloth on the block! Revel in the silliness of the slothpacalypse, shoot everything that moves and start hoarding pizza!

Source: The Developer Website.

208638.description:
Game description from the publisher:

This six-scenario pack revolves around battles of the German invasion of Fortress Holland and is compatible with MMP's ASL™ System and modifiable to be used with other miniature Wargaming systems.

Blitzkrieg in the West - Northern Campaign scenarios can be played separately, or the six scenarios may be linked together to form a campaign game by playing each scenario in order. At the conclusion of each scenario, both sides total up their Victory Points (VP); and at the end of the last scenario these VP are totalled, and the side with most VP wins.

The scenarios are designed with replayablility in mind. Each scenario features a base force and variable attachments to that force. Base forces and variable attachments are based on historical availability for that scenario. At the start of each scenario: Base Force + Variable Attachment = Scenario Order of Battle.
208638.name: Blitzkrieg in the West: Northern Campaign

208639.name: Kentucky Route Zero: Act IV
videogamehonor: 2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Honorable Mention
208639.description:
Kentucky Route Zero is a magical realist adventure game about a secret highway in the caves beneath Kentucky, and the mysterious folks who travel it. Gameplay is inspired by point-and-click adventure games (like the classic Monkey Island or King's Quest series, or more recently Telltale's Walking Dead series), but focused on characterization, atmosphere and storytelling rather than clever puzzles or challenges of skill.

Source: The Game Website.

208640.name: Battle Academy - Rommel in Normandy
208640.description:
This time, play the Normandy campaign from the other side as the Germans and their mighty Tigers through ten varied missions. Take command from the initial chaos of the airborne drops all the way through to the desperate escape from the Falaise pocket and learn the skills required to control an army stretched to its limit by years of war. Can you master some of the most modern and deadly units of WW2? Will you struggle to hold the line with battered equipment against the overwhelming mass of the Allied invasion? Find out in "Rommel in Normandy"!

Source: The Publisher Website.

208641.name: Education in Terror
208641.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is designed for 5 characters of level 6-12. Although written as taking place in northeastern Illinois, the GM should feel free to relocate it to wherever his campaign is normally situated.

Before the adventure begins, the GM can foreshadow it by dropping hints and rumors in earlier episodes of the campaign.

The players may have heard rumors of the Crime Academy, an elite school for super-villains. Its existence spoken of only in whispers by the leaders of the Underworld. The GM should expose the players to vague rumors of this institution, but no leads or substantial evidence for them to follow up on.

Another rumor concerns several incidents of the theft of quantities of Hyperbium, a mineral with no known practical use or market value that is found only in certain ancient meteor fragments. There have been a few sightings of perpetrators, but none have fit the descriptions of any known super villains. They were Crime Academy students.

Finally, there are persistent but unverified sightings of hideous "lobster people" reported in the tabloid press.

208642.name: Guards of Atlantis: Sabina & Ignatia character pack
208642.description:
A box containing 2 models for the expansion characters for the game and their corresponding decks of cards.

This expansion allows playing the Guards of Atlantis with 10-11 players.

208643.name: Tierisch bedroht
208643.description:
The players are animal rights activists, who have the goal to save as many endangered animals from extinction. Only when they work together on strategies and skillfully utilize the available resources, they succeed to retake the habitat of the animals. Animal welfare is teamwork!

The cards represent the threatend species from three different habitats (green: land, blue: water, orange: air).
There are 5-6 (depending on the number of players) animals laying face down in the middle of the table, so every player can see the habitat, but not the needs of the animal (like "2 air and 1 money").
Now the players have to choose a "strategic card", which gives one player a special move (like switching a card on the table, or looking at a card).
After that, the players have to play ressources from their hand face down on an animal of their choice. When each player has played their card (now communication allowed at that point), the animals and ressources are revealed and all animals, where the ressources match the needs are saved.

208644.name: Battle Academy 2: Kursk
208644.description:
In the summer of 1943 both Soviet and German High Commands gathered their strength for what they both believed would be a decisive battle.

The Germans assembled their most powerful divisions, freshly equipped with the latest equipment, to attack the north and south flanks of the salient around the city of Kursk.
