The Small Folk have been lurking on the margins of human society since before the dawn of history, but we humans don't tend to notice them. They're really good at hiding from us. They're also good at arguing, picking fights, sulking, and splitting up into cliques. But they're tough, clever (on their good days), and armed with an array of startling magical powers.

The Small Folk is a game of wainscot urban fantasy, built round the popular FATE rules engine. Take your pick of seven different cliques, from aggressive goblins to oh-so-superior brownies and technophile gremlins (or the cliqueless, because some people just have to be different), and an array of skills and magical powers, personalise your character with aspects and stunts, and get out there and get underfoot.

Oh, and watch out for cats, rats, hawks, mousetraps, and your neighbours.

208765.name: The Ranger, Revised
208765.description:
Publisher blurb

Over the past year, you’ve seen us try a number of new approaches to the ranger, all aimed at addressing the class’s high levels of player dissatisfaction and its ranking as D&D’s weakest class by a significant margin.

Those two factors combined to put us on the path to this revision. Though the revised ranger retains many of the elements of the existing class, a lot has changed, so it’s best to simply dig into the new material to get a sense of how it feels. But at the same time, the release of this revision gives us a chance to talk about how a revised class can best be implemented as part of the D&D game—and how the game will evolve in the future.

You can think of the material presented in this series as similar to the first wave of the fifth edition playtest. These game mechanics are in draft form, usable in your campaign but not fully tempered by playtests and design iterations. They are highly volatile and might be unstable; if you use them, be ready to rule on any issues that come up. They’re written in pencil, not ink. For these reasons, material in this column is not legal in D&D Organized Play events.

The material presented in Unearthed Arcana will range from mechanics that we expect one day to publish in a supplement to house rules from our home campaigns that we want to share, from core system options to setting-specific material. Once it’s out there, you can expect us to check in with you to see how it’s working out and what we can do to improve it.

208766.name: 13 Clues
208766.description:
Description from the publisher:

The city of London has been shaken by heinous crimes, and Scotland Yard is groping in the dark. 13 Clues, set at the end of the 19th century, puts players in the shoes of the detectives, each trying to solve their own mystery. Each player sees the clues — person + location + weapon — for the other players but not their own. They investigate by asking questions, by consulting the secret informant, and by making accusations in order to collect clues and rule out suspects. The goal of the game is to identify which of the 13 clues match their case before the others do!

208767.name: Play Ball! A Baseball Game of Skill
208767.description:
This 1930's title is a physical-dexterity baseball game. The cardboard playing field is inset in the bottom of the box and has 23 holes punched into it, each with a result ranging from Out to Home Run. A 3" wooden bat is mounted on a wooden peg beside home plate, which has a small hole in it.

The At-Bat player puts a marble on home plate, and then flicks the bat to propel the marble across the field. If the ball fails to fall into any of the holes, it is a strike, with three strikes as usual causing an out, and three outs ending the inning.

208768.name: Pressman Action Baseball
208768.description:
This is an action-dexterity version of baseball, with a pressed-metal field mounted inside a wooden frame. The infield and foul territory are at a higher level than the outfield. There are two foul-out holes in the higher level, and 38 holes across the lower outfield, of which 13 are outs, 1 is a double play, 12 are singles, 8 are doubles, 3 are triples, and 1 is a home run.

There is a thin springy metal loop near 2nd base that the pitching player uses to send the ball toward home plate. There is a spring-loaded 4" wooden bat that the batting player holds back and releases to strike the ball. There is a small bell behind home plate labeled "Automatic Umpire": if the batter does not swing, a pitch hitting the bell is a strike, while one missing it is a ball.

While the game is undated, the box is labeled "A Lynn Pressman Original", suggesting that it was published after her husband Jack Pressman's death in 1959.

208769.name: Mundo Neurente
208769.description:
ENGLISH: Tired of fighting each other for religious supremacy and that these wars have caused many human deaths and the need to remain toghether against the threats of evil, the good neurents have agreed to face each other in a peaceful competition. In this event can participate up to six of the world's great religions. The winner will prevail as the only world religion and thereafter guide the designs of human beings until you play again. Instead of acting directly on humans, they have decided to conquer their sources of survival: earth, water, air, fire, flora and fauna. The first to achieve to conquer any of them will win because humans depend entirely on it to survive. Each religion will have four participants in the competition shall strictly comply with the following rules. You will be responsible for guiding your steps. Hopefully your gods help you in this mission.

Using their pawns, the players (as individuals or teams) must conquer areas that are not initially of their own color. When anyone has managed to conquer all tiles of a given resource will become the winner.

ESPAÑOL: Cansados de luchar entre sí por la supremacía religiosa, de que estas guerras hayan causado tantos muertos humanos y de la necesidad de estar unidos ante las amenazas del mal, los neurentes buenos han acordado enfrentarse entre sí en una competición pacífica. En la contienda podrán participar hasta 6 de las grandes religiones del mundo. El ganador prevalecerá como única religión mundial y guiará a partir de entonces los designios de los humanos... hasta que se vuelva a jugar. En lugar de actuar directamente sobre los humanos, han decido conquistar sus fuentes de supervivencia: tierra, agua, aire, fuego, flora y fauna. El primero que logre dominar alguna de ellas será el vencedor porque los humanos dependerán completamente de él para sobrevivir. Cada religión tendrá cuatro participantes en la competición que deberán cumplir estrictamente las siguientes reglas. Tú serás el encargado de guiar sus pasos. Esperemos que tus dioses te ayuden en esta misión.

Utilizando los peones, los jugadores (individualmente o por equipos) deberán conquistar zonas que no sean inicialmente de su color. Cuando alguno haya logrado conquistar todas las casillas de un recurso determinado se convertirá en el ganador.

208770.name: Atlantis
208770.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unda Da Sea!

Prince Ravas (AKA Sea Devil) rules Atlantis. But how did he become king? What else is down there? What would you run into if you were to visit?

This issue outlines a little more Atlantean history, describes the Trident of Poseidon, and details the people, and the enemies, of Atlantis!

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

208771.name: The Period Game
208771.description:
Game description from the designers:

The Period Game strives to turn a typically uneasy situation into a fun, positive, learning experience. It is designed to teach participants about what is happening within the female body and how to "go with the flow."

Every turn begins with a player turning one of the two ovaries, releasing a marble into the tray below.

A red marble came out? Congrats! You got your period. A clear marble? Better luck next time. Depending on where your marble takes you, play a protection card, preparation card or go to the nurse’s office.

Make it around the board before anyone else to win. Either way, you’re a pro at handling your period.

208772.name: Dicks & Krakens
208772.description:
This game is a re-theming of Snakes and Ladders to the web comic Looking for Group: the snakes are replaced with the warlock Tiny Dick's fwooshes, and the ladders with the kraken Scooter's tentacles.

It is also an extension of Snakes and Ladders in two ways:

Characters: Each pawn stands for a different LFG character, with its own unique ability, such as rolling twice and choosing the higher number, or reversing the direction of the fwooshes and tentacles.
Hit Points: Each character has hit points, which can be lost by going down a fwoosh, or losing in a combat when one pawn passes another. They are gradually healed by skipping turns.

208773.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Quartermaster General: 1914 is the next title in the critically acclaimed Quartermaster General series by Ian Brody and creates a narrative of the First World War in Europe, reflecting the military, technological, and social changes that occurred over the following four years.

In Quartermaster General: 1914, each card has two different uses: one when played, and another when prepared. On your turn, you have the opportunity to both play and prepare a card. You can also spend cards to draft more troops, or use cards to attrition your opponents. However, your deck represents your overall resources, so moving too quickly through your deck early might result in your unsupported armies being swept away in the final rounds of the game. This is worth it if you can capture Berlin or Paris in 1915, but if your gambit fails, you may have a tough road ahead.

The game ends after 17 rounds of play, or earlier if one side has a commanding lead.
208773.name: Quartermaster General: 1914
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #115 - Los problemas del primer mundo jugón

208774.name: Fitch's Game of Natural History
208774.description:
This 1887 card game was designed to teach children the names and images of animals. The deck has 40 cards, each with the name and large ink drawing of an animal on top, and four small drawings and animal names underneath, forming sets of five cards to be collected. Each card also bears a number from 1 to 8 to identify the set. This is intended to allow children to call for cards even if they don't yet read well.

The game uses a "go-fish" mechanism, with five cards initially dealt to each player. Players ask for another animal from another player, get another turn if they are successful, and draw from the top of the deck if they are not. Player collecting the most sets wins.

The cover of the box notes the patent registration date of Aug. 23rd, 1887 and displays the price of 25 cents. The side of the box declares: "Natural History Made Easy and Amusing: Fun, Wit and Knowledge combined."

208775.description:
This is a new edition of the Spiel des Jahres-nominated dice game. In this version everything is bigger, the players have boards with dry erase markers in place of the original paper and pencil. This edition is also for up to 8 players instead of only 5 in the original game. The biggest change in this edition, though, is that on the back of the regular player boards are the Qwixx Mixx boards which have the colors scrambled throughout the different lines, which changes many of the strategies while keeping the mechanisms largely the same.

The rules for Qwixx:

Qwixx is a quick-playing dice game in which everyone participates, no matter whose turn it is. Each player has a scoresheet with the numbers 2-12 in rows of red and yellow and the numbers 12-2 in rows of green and blue. To score points you want to mark off as many numbers as possible, but you can mark off a number only if it's to the right of all marked-off numbers in the same row.

On a turn, the active player rolls six dice: two white and one of each of the four colors listed above. Each player can choose to mark off the sum of the two white dice on one of their four rows, then the active player can choose to mark off the sum of one colored die and one white die in the row that's the same color as the die. The more marks you can make in a row, the higher your score for that row. Fail to cross off a number when you're the active player, however, and you must mark one of four penalty boxes on your scoresheet. If you mark off the 2 or 12 in a row and have at least five numbers marked in that row, you get to also mark off the padlock symbol in that row, locking everyone else out of this color.

When either a player has four penalty boxes marked or a second color is locked, the game ends immediately. Players then tally their points for each color, sum these values, then subtract five points for each marked penalty box. Whoever has the highest score wins.
208775.name: Qwixx Deluxe
boardgamepodcastepisode: #35: Fabled Fruit on tap; Six Pack of Games for the Holidays

208776.description:
The ancient reptilian civilization of the Sarens disappeared millions years ago. They knew all about matter manipulation and hyperspace travel. The remains of this civilization plunge into oblivion are spread across Heos’s realms and are full of powerful relics that defy the imagination.

Expeditions have engaged in an archaeological journey on behalf of powerful factions and their members will use all of their abilities to achieve their ends. For prophecy is that when enough relics have been found, a dimensional portal will open to go on the moon Wym, the cradle of the Secret of the Sarens...

Each player leads an expedition in order to collect Sarens relics. Expeditions are made of 3 type of cards: Regions, Classes & Factions:

On each Region card, you will find 2 to 4 relics.
Each Class card has only 1 relic, but it is balanced by abilities like looking at the other players cards or destroying a type of card.
Each Faction has a permanent effect that can reverse the situation.




Players will activate their cards in order to find more Relics than the other players and try to guess the other player's score in order to end the game at the right time.
208776.name: Le Secret des Sarens
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

208777.name: Rockalypse
208777.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to post-apocalyptic musical conflict!

The world has ended, and only music can save what's left. Grab your instruments, form your band, and get ready to fight demons, road gangs, and megacorps using the only real weapon: ROCK!

This is the digital version of the full Rockalypse print release. It includes rules for both Fate Core and Fate Accelerated.

208779.name: Gravel
208779.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sticks? No! STONES!!

As part of the new Crime Cartel, Slate Manning, aka Gravel (PL 10), battles the city's hero, Recluse. Able to reform, reshape, and regrow himself each time he is reduced to rubble, Gravel has proved a rather difficult foe to get rid of.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

208780.name: Perfect Woman
208780.description:
Perfect Woman is a game inspired by the ubiquitous personality questionnaires featured in women’s magazines and the female roles they define. There are so many such roles emphasizing aspects of family, career, experience, sex and more. But these can not possibly characterize the depth and complexity of a woman’s life.

Source: The Publisher Website.

208781.name: Spaera
208781.description:
The world of SPAERA is heavily inspired by characters, gameplay and themes from games that we loved to play as we were growing up.

Source: The Game Website.

208782.name: Event[0]
videogamehonor: 2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
208782.description:
Event[0] is a sci-fi narrative exploration game where you build a relationship with a lonely spaceship computer to get home to Earth.

Source: The Game Website.

208783.name: Riders: A Game About Cheating Doomsday
rpg: Riders: A Game About Cheating Doomsday
208783.description:
(publisher blurb)

So let me get this straight: We're mortal servants of the Four Horsemen, who want us to ride around and witness the End of Days. But we don't want the world to end, so we are cheating Doomsday? Some sympathetic angels gave us an ancient Babylonian rite that lets us know what events will trigger The End, so we can go and fix the problems and avert Kingdom Come?

And both Heaven and Hell want us dead dead dead because they think we actually want to pull the trigger, and they aren't sure who'll win yet?

But we get to save the world? Command powers of Conquest, War, Famine, and Death? Ride awesome motorcycles?

Ah hell -- let's ride!

208784.name: In Pursuit of Greed
208784.description:
User Summary

A First Person Shooter set in the future. The player selects one of five mercenaries belonging to a scavenging team sent into dangerous areas to retrieve valuable items. Level completion involves collecting a "primary" valuable item and scoring a certain amount of points. Points are scored from collecting items and defeating enemies. Items and enemies are randomly generated and respawn. Each playable character starts with two unique weapons, and three other general weapons can be collected as the game progresses.

208786.name: Nodes
208786.description:
Nodes is a strategy game for two or four players. The game board is octagonal, and each space is the intersection of a horizontal, vertical, and two diagonal lines. There are thus eight lines emanating out from each space in the manner of a compass rose.

There are two types of pieces: nodes and units. Nodes are akin to the king in Chess. They only can move one space, and a player wins when they surround their opponent's node. Units are akin to pawns in chess. They are the main troops in the game and form the basis of each player's strategy. Each player has one node and eight units throughout the game.

Unlike chess, however, the placement of the nodes on the board also determines how the units can move. The lines that extend in eight directions from the space a node occupies are called "lines of communication." If a unit is located along a line of communication the unit can move, whether it's the player's node or their opponent's. If the unit moves into a space that is also along the same line as a node, it can move again. But if a unit moves out of line or starts a turn out of line, it can't move.

A player's turn involves moving as many pieces as they want as many spaces as they want in order to defend their own node and attack their opponent's node. Every turn asks the players to make strategic decisions about when to attack, when to defend, and how to do both with only eight units. At the end of a player's turn, they move their node, and the other player makes their move. The game ends when one player is unable to move their node.

208788.name: Snowdice
208788.description:
It snowed all night. At the break of dawn, the players rush to the streets to create the most extraordinary snowman.

Taking turns, the players throw the dices and try to put together as many snowman as possible, depending on the dices.
A snow ball and a scarf on one hand, a snow ball and some buttons on the other hand...

Players score points depending on their snow figure creations.

The player who scores the most points wins!

208792.description: Beast at the Gates is a hex and counter brigade level game simulating the Battle of Drewry's Bluff, published in Yaah #7. It uses old school mechanics but features leader personality ratings, a streamlined activation system, random events, and simplified artillery rules. Six scenarios allow players to explore the possibilities of this often overlooked battle.
208792.name: The Beast at the Gates: Drewry's Bluff 1864

208793.name: Polarity
208793.description:
Play the worlds most dangerous hacker as you break into a virtual vault, destroying security systems and stealing sensitive data for the mysterious Linus corporation in this first person puzzler.

Source: The Developer Website.

208794.name: Fractal Spectrum (Issue 15 - Spring 1997)
rpgissuearticle: Featured Review: Harnmaster Core Rules, 2nd Ediction
Featured Review: The Star Wars Roleplaying Game, Second Edition
208794.description: The Magazine for the Creative Gamer

208795.name: Order of Battle: Rising Sun
208795.description:
The ultimate goal of Imperial Japan is to become the dominant power in the western Pacific. In December 1941, a carefully planned strategy is set in motion through a series of major offensives, including a carrier strike on the US naval base at Pearl Harbor. The shock of these surprise attacks is intended to cripple the Allied forces, giving the Japanese army and navy the time needed to establish total hegemony over their opponents.

Rising Sun puts the player in command of the Imperial Navy – built around a powerful fleet of battleships and aircraft carriers, as well as the Imperial Army – hardened from years of war with the Chinese. Managing the limited resources available to build a well-balanced force of unique units such as the lethal A6M Zero fighter aircraft and the mighty Yamato battleship class will be the key to a successful outcome of the Japanese offensive. From the beginning of the campaign, starting with the air raid against Pearl Harbor, the initiative lays in the hands of Japan, but as Allied resistance stiffens, only a commander able to achieve decisive victories can keep up the momentum and fulfill Japan’s imperial dreams.

Scenarios

Pearl Harbor
Road To Manila
Bataan
Java Sea
Java
Coral Sea
Midway
Guadalcanal
New Caledonia
Brisbane
New Zealand
Melbourne

Source: The Developer Website.

208796.name: Order of Battle – U.S. Marines
208796.description:
In the spring of 1942 the Japanese suffer their first major setbacks of the Pacific War with the naval battles of Coral Sea and Midway. Seizing this opportunity to take back the initiative, US High Command launches an offensive operation against forward Japanese outposts in the Solomon Islands.

As part of this expeditionary force, the US Marine Corps is tasked with assaulting the islands of Tulagi and Guadalcanal. A long and bloody campaign of island hopping in the Pacific Ocean has begun…

Order of Battle: U.S. Marines puts players in control of the elite U.S. military branch which proved essential in the Allied victory over Japan. While Order of Battle – Pacific featured the major ground and naval battles of the Pacific War, this new expansion follows the story of the U.S. Marine Corps during the island hopping campaign of 1942-1945. As the fighting progresses across small, isolated jungle islands, the Japanese adapt their strategy from ruthless assaults to deep, well-prepared defensive systems – determined to hold on and fight to the last man.

Source: The Developer Website.

208797.name: Order of Battle: Winter War
208797.description:
On November 30th 1939, three months after the outbreak of World War 2, the Soviet Union declares war on the neutral nation of Finland. Under the pretext of seeking territorial changes to protect the city of Leningrad, the vast Red Army envisions a quick victory against the small and poorly equipped Finnish defence force.

Outnumbered three to one and facing an enemy with an insurmountable superiority in tanks and aircraft, a great challenge lays ahead of the Finnish Army. But its brave and stubborn soldiers, fighting for their homes and families, every intent to welcome the enemy to a freezing hell of ice and fire.

This new expansion for Order of Battle includes the Winter War (1939-1940), the Continuation War (1941-1944) and the Lapland War (1944-1945). Players take control of the Finnish Army and, according to the shifting tides of war, allied troops from Germany or the Soviet Union.

Source: The Developer Website.

208798.name: "Ready, Aim...Draw!"
208798.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Fast-Action Packed Drawing and Guessing Game for Outdoor Sporting Enthusiasts! "Ready, Aim...Draw!", is the zany fast-paced action game of sketching, drawing, doodling, guessing and yelling. Entertaining words and phrases from all outdoor sporting activities including fishing, hunting, camping, boating, first aid, sporting safety, wildlife, trapping, wildlife conservation and nature test and challenge the drawing skills of the Sketcher and the perceptive guessing skills of the Guessers. As Players sketch, individuals or team members attempt to guess the word or phrase with correct guesses being rewarded with points or colored poker chips. Collect all four chips and play resumes at the "Roulette Wheel" where with a little luck the player can win the game!

208799.name: Our America: A Game for All Generations
208799.description: A family game of fun facts about the U.S.A. Fun for all generations! Learn about the history, heroes and heritage of the U.S.A. as you play. Roll the color die to see which of the six different categories of questions is yours to answer. Have fun following the state flags around your own game board. First player to collect all six category cards and reach the finish square wins!

208800.name: Ceres: Operation Stolen Base
208800.description:
Ceres: Operation Stolen Base is a solitaire game depicting the actions of an elite Rebel task force attempting to seize the largest source of water in the Solar System shortly after the outbreak of the Free Mars Revolution. Your task force must defeat the Earth Federation ships in the area and seize the primary surface base.

The opposition forces are controlled by the game system using a deck of cards whereby a card is drawn after the player moves a task force, which may result in a new opposing force being placed where the task force just moved and forcing combat to occur. Some locations are more likely to have larger opposition forces to appear than others and although initial opposition forces will be relatively small, resistance will increase as their alert level increases.

Players begin the game with a number of assembly points with which they can use to custom-build their fleet, including adding special weapon pods to ships to provide benefits such as drone defenses and cyber warfare abilities to keep enemy alert levels lower. If your fleet includes an assembly ship, you can even repair and alter your fleet even after your attack on Ceres begins.

Four increasingly difficult missions must be completed to win the campaign game. Along the way, additional ships arrive and pods are constructed to increase strength and technological capabilities. A unique card system counts down the time remaining and provides challenges and opportunities at every orbit.

In this game the player takes command of a Rebel task force attempting to complete missions critical to securing the Ceres water base. Your success will ensure Mars and other colonies have a major source of water for survival and the Earth Federation will be forced to haul water up the deep and costly gravity well from Earth.

This game is set in the Free Mars universe and is a prequel to the Free Mars boxed game.

Game Contents:
• 11 x 17” map
• 40 die-cut counters
• 18 mini cards
• Scenario Instructions
• Four page rule booklet

208801.name: Phobos Rising!
208801.description:
Phobos Rising! Insurgency on Mars is a solitaire game depicting the heroic actions of an elite team attempting to secure key facilities on Mars. Success means Mars has been secured and the Martian Revolution, depicted at the start of the Free Mars game, begins with a general uprising across the colonies bases and ships in the Solar System.

The player starts with a handful of team members and a few gear enhancements. Four increasingly difficult missions must be completed to win the campaign game. Moving across a map depicting the Martian geography from Olympus Mons to Valles Marineris, Earth Federation forces will attempt to stop the team from completing its missions. Your team will be able to recruit additional members, obtain specialized gear to enhance skills, and acquire shuttles to speed movement. A unique card system counts down the time remaining and provides both challenges and opportunities at every turn.

In this game the player takes command of a Rebel team attempting to complete missions critical to initiating the Free Mars Revolution. Your success will help ensure Mars is secure from Earth Federation forces and ready to support the Rebel fleet gathering overhead.

This game is set in the Free Mars universe and is a prequel to the Free Mars boxed game.

Game Contents:
• 11 x 17” map
• 40 die-cut counters
• 18 mini cards
• Scenario Instructions
• Four page rule booklet

208804.description:
Lockdown is the third episode in the ongoing saga that started with The Captain is Dead. This time our intrepid crew find themselves prisoners on their own ship. Hostile aliens have taken control. The crew must work together and remain hidden while attempting to regain control of the ship.

Lockdown (aka Episode 3) is an expansion of The Captain is Dead, and therefore you must have the original game (aka Episode 1) to play it. Just like Episode 1 and 2, Episode 3 is a co-op game for 1 to 7 players.
208804.name: The Captain Is Dead: Episode 3 - Lockdown

208805.description: A 36 Card Expansion for Shindig Machine with new artwork that expands the storytelling possibilities of the core set.
208805.name: Shindig Machine: Bits & Pieces

208806.name: Rise of Venice - Beyond the Sea
208806.description:
Stock a crate of your finest Chianti vintage on board your vessel and prepare to set sail once again. ‘Beyond The Sea’, the first major add-on for the acclaimed economy simulator Rise of Venice, is about to take you to distant new lands in which to trade luxurious goods and exert your influence in. From Marseilles to Lisbon, the add-on provides players with a whole new challenge by expanding the game world with 13 cities to explore and trade with.

Also included are all new residence missions and challenging new Doge tasks, which will see your family playing a more significant role in your position and plans. ‘Beyond The Sea’ also allows players to command a completely new class of ship – the NAO: the famous ship type in which Christopher Columbus discovered America in 1492.

Source: The Publisher Website.

208807.name: Rainbow Rage
208807.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet — the colors of the rainbow. Easy, right?

Better think again because this isn't your average rainbow. Big Potato are excited to present their most tense, all-or-nothing game to date: Rainbow Rage. The rules are simple: flip a rainbow card, spot the difference and race to grab the two colors that have swapped places. Spot a perfect rainbow card (with all the colors in the right order) and shout "Rainbow!" to pick up a color of your choice. Once you've collected every color and built your own perfect rainbow to victory, you're declared the winner. Doesn't sound too stressful? Well watch out, keeping hold of your colors isn't as easy as you might think. Grab the wrong color? Return one to the middle. Grab both wrong colors? Return two to the middle. Over excitedly yell "Rainbow!" at the wrong moment? Return all of your colors to the middle. Strap yourself in and get ready to tame some rainbows!

208808.name: OK Play
208808.description:
Game description from the publisher:

With nothing but four stacks of coloured tiles, it's no wonder why OK Play is regarded as the world's easiest to understand game. Don't let that fool you though - whilst this game takes minutes to learn, it takes ages to master. The rules are simple: using your stack of tiles, you try to make a line of five before any of your opponents can. Each tile must line up with the flat side of another (no placing corners on corners) and your line of five can go orthogonally or diagonally. If you manage to use all of your tiles and there's still no winner, you can reposition them one at a time. Whether you're from Albania or Zambia, speaking in Urdu or Zulu or playing against a rabbi or a Jedi, OK Play can go anywhere and be played by anyone, with anyone (even if you can't understand a word the other person is saying).

208809.name: Dogs of War
videogameversion: Amiga 16-bit Pocket Power Collection release (budget release)
208809.description:
Dogs of War is a run and gun game developed and published in 1989 by Elite Systems for the Amiga and Atari ST. The name "Dogs of War" is probably taken from the 1981 movie The Dogs of War.

The acclaimed game music was made by David Whittaker.

Plot and gameplay'
The main character, who bears a striking resemblance to Rambo, is a mercenary who is asked to carry out assignments all over the world.

The levels in Dogs of War are built in a similar way, a multi-directional scrolling shooter where the player must overcome enemies who drift along in certain patterns on the screen, ultimately reaching his goal. People from around the world ask the player to conduct missions for them. Examples include saving someone's kidnapped son, retrieving a valuable piece of art or killing a criminal. Note that all missions end in the same way - to accomplish it, the player only has to approach the goal. All missions are available to play from the start, although some levels are harder than others. Accordingly, those missions tempt the player with a larger bounty. Killing enemies during the missions gives the player more money. Money is imperative as the player must buy all his weapons as well as ammunition before each mission. Weapons in the game include pistols, Kalashnikovs, chain guns, grenades, rocket launchers and a flame thrower. Rocket launchers are needed to take down heavy obstacles such as turrets, military jeeps and tanks. A two-player mode is also available.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dogs_of_War_%281989_video_game%29 Dogs of War (1989 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208810.name: Kicsoda? Micsoda?
208810.description: The aim of the game is to answer the rhyming riddles correctly. The correct answer is shown on the other side of each card.

208811.name: Torvak the Warrior
208811.description:
Torvak the Warrior is a hack and slash platform game published by Core Design in 1990. The game was released for the Commodore Amiga and Atari ST. The gameplay has been compared to that of the Rastan Saga series.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torvak_the_Warrior Torvak the Warrior]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208812.name: The Ultimate Ride
208812.description:
Box back
Tame your dream machine in the Ultimate bike racing challange - The Ulrimate Ride brings two wheeled action hurtling into your living room at its raw, nerve ringling best.

Take 6 of the best superbikes and race them on a world tour od the famous grand prix circuits. If the open road is more to your liking then you can take it 'country style' on 6 fiendishly designed road courses set in different locations.

The Ultimate Ride even lets you design your own courses using the unique Artificially Intelligent track editior. Challenge a friend on the simultaneous two player option or create custom disks of your favourite track and bike.

The Ultimate Ride combines ultra fast road racing graphics with unequailed presentation and animation - This is a real interactive racing movie

- Fast and furios motorbike racing action.
- Unique 'through the visor' view of the road.
- Amazing 180* tuktubg horizon and road objects.
- Carefully researched and simulated bike handling.
- Ride 6 of the fastest sport bikes in the world...
- On 6 of the world's most exciting Grand Prix circuits...
- And accross 6 challenging cross-country races...
- Or make your own track with the amazing editor!
- Simultaneously split screen two player mode.
- Exhilarating roller coaster road effects.
- Read 'sampled' digial sound effects.
- Create custom disks of your favourite bike and track combination
- All in all it's The Ultimate Ride!

Can you take the power?

208813.name: Fiendish Freddy's Big Top O' Fun
208813.description:
Fiendish Freddy's Big Top O'Fun is a video game developed by Gray Matter under developer Chris Gray and published in 1990 by Mindscape. It originally appeared on the 16-bit Atari ST, IBM PC and Commodore Amiga, before later being converted to the ZX Spectrum, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC. The Commodore 64 version was included on the bundled cartridge of the ill-fated Commodore 64 Games System.

A corrupt businessman, whom the circus owes $10,000, arrives on the scene with the intent of demolishing the circus unless it can pay up. He plans to build a set of luxury hotels on the terrain. In a fit of desperation, the showmaster organises a display of six events to raise money for the doomed circus: diving, juggling, trapeze, knife throwing, tightrope and the human cannonball. The performance in each event is judged by five clown judges, who offer money depending on the quality of the show. The businessman has no intention of letting the circus raise the cash though, and he sends his lackey, the evil Fiendish Freddy, to sabotage the acts.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiendish_Freddy%27s_Big_Top_O%27Fun Fiendish Freddy's Big Top O'Fun]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208814.name: The Humans 2: The Jurassic Levels
208814.description:
User Summary
Was available as data disk for Humans or stand-alone.

Box back - Titled: Humans 2 The Jurassic Levels
HUMANS 2 THE JURASSIC LEVELS
"Just what the heck are HUMANS?... and what are they doing in a computer game anyhow?! We know, we've heard it before, they're strange, they're ugly, they're...stupid. But there's more to these HUMANS than meets the eye, for inside each and everyone of them is a small but useable brain, Working as a team and discovering new tools (fire, weapons, the wheel, deodorant, etc.) is the key to survival in this vruel world of chaos and carnivores, Itøs a native struggle against extinction, where you score points by finishing levels with as many of your tribesmen intact as HUMAN-ly possible. Love, death, food... it's all here. With Gametek's computer version of HUMAN, the only missing link is you.

Box back - Titled: Human Race - The Jurrassic Levels
WHAT YOU GET
The front of this box tells you wether this is a stand alone version of "HUMAN RACE - THE JURASSIC LEVELS" or the data disks. If you already own HUMANS then you need buy only the data disks which SHOULD BE CHEAPER. If you are new to HUMANS, then buy the stand alone version of HUMAN RACE - THE JURASSIC LEVELS or the original HUMANS game and THE JURASSIC LEVELS fata disks.
HUMAN RACE - THE JURASSIC LEVELS contains a further 80 levels of evolutionary mayhem. If you thought that the first version was challenging and addictive then try this!

208815.name: Slave Pits of the Undercity
208815.description:
Conversion Guide

Publisher's blurb:

In 1980, TSR published A1: Slave Pits of the Undercity. It was written by David 'Zeb' Cook and illustrated by Jeff Dee, Dave LaForce, Jim Roslof, and Bill Willingham. The 22-page booklet had an outer folder containing maps.

This adventure was originally designed as a tournament module, rewarding players for what they accomplished in addition to how long they survived. It became part of A - Aerie of the Slave Lords and is ranked #20 in Dragon The 30 Greatest D&D Adventures of All Time.

This conversion guide allows DMs to run the original module with 5th Edition rules and provides a reference sheet for encounters, magic items, traps and creatures.

User summary:

Note the original module is required for the use of this conversion product.

208816.name: Bake off
208816.description:
The official board game of Bake off TV Show.
In turn the players play the role of judge, while the other players are competitors and perform 2 tests:

Technical test: each competitor receives a card depicting a sweet and must put on his plate the ingredients that he thinks are appropriate to realize, quickly taking them from those places in the center of the table. The first to complete their own sweet takes the whisk on the table. Depending on the correctness of the collected ingredients, players gain prize chips and cards for the next test.
Creative test: each competitor creates a sweet using the ingredient cards in your possession. The best recipes according to the current judge gain prize chips.




Players insert their chips within their paper cups.
When everyone has played the role of judge the game ends: who has the most chips is the winner.

208817.name: The Pits of Wob
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208817.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

The Pits of Wob" is a free PDF module for the 1ST EDITION ADVENTURE GAME rules, suitable for introductory to novice level players.
Compatible with OSRIC and similar retroclones.
Playtested on Unseen Servant. Artwork by Martin.
Published by Elfgrim Bor∂spil Jan.2016.

based on "Hall of the Kobold King" by Emil Larsson

208819.name: Alla ricerca di Dory: Occhio al tentacolo
208819.description:
A board game based on the Disney/Pixar film Finding Dory.
Each player takes a Dory figure and tries to meet his four friends, avoiding the tentacles of the octopus Hank, and go home with them.
The current player spins the spinner and decides to move based on the number or color of the arrow: if the destination square is occupied by another player, the current player moves further.
After the movement, the player flips the coin of the target square and, according to it, he can: meet one of his friends, turn the spinner again, move to a square he likes or rotate Hank tentacles 90 degrees. It is useful to remember what is depicted in the chips, so you better choose whether to move by color or number.
If the spinner lands on octopus Hank, the player rotates 90 degrees clockwise or counterclockwise: if its tentacles hits one or more figures, they come back to the starting square.
The winner is the first to meet all 4 Dory friends and returns to the starting square.

208820.name: Zecchino d'Oro
208820.description:
The official board game of Zecchino d'Oro: a TV Show competition where small children sing a song.
Players have to perform some tests to earn tiles to complete their mini puzzles.
The current player rolls the die and, depending on the square he lands, perform one of the following tests:

Answer to a curiosity concerning the Zecchino d'Oro and its most famous songs;
Complete the verse of a song, choosing one of three options proposed;
Sing, mime or draw a song, so the other players can guess it;
Draw 2 cards with images and invents a verse by being inspired by them.




If the test is successful, the current player can find out 2 tiles placed on the table: if they belong to his minipuzzle, he can keep them, otherwise he puts them in their place, always face down. Anyone can try to remember the location of their tiles, to discover them during his turn.
The player who completes their mini puzzle first, is the winner.

208821.name: Minimig
208821.description:
User Summary
A Amiga 500 hardware emulator.

Wikipedia
Minimig (short for Mini Amiga) is an open source re-implementation of an Amiga 500 using a field-programmable gate array (FPGA).

Minimig started in secrecy around January 2005 as a proof of concept by Dutch electrical engineer Dennis van Weeren. He intended Minimig as the answer to the ongoing discussions within the Amiga community on implementing the Amiga custom chipset using an FPGA. The project's source code and schematics were released under version 3 of the GNU General Public Licence on 25 July 2007.

rpgseries: The Shackled City Adventure Path Conversion
208822.name: Zenith Trajectory
208822.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a conversion guide to [5th Edition for] the third chapter of The Shackled City Adventure Path.

User summary:

This product is an item-by-item conversion guide for The Shackled City Adventure Path as originally published in Dungeon. This conversion guide covers only the portion of the adventure path contained in Zenith Trajectory published in Dungeon (Issue 102 - Sep 2003) / Polyhedron (Issue 161). The original material is required to use this product.

208823.name: A Big Misunderstanding
208823.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two adventurers are walking the streets at night, each going about their own business. As they pass, the buildings around them explode as a hulking villain emerges. The adventurers are faced with two options: flee for their lives, or die fighting!

You should buy this adventure if you fit into either of the following two categories:

You want to run up to 8 adventures for two 1st-level. This adventure is a fantastic demo game: you can run it several times without ever experiencing the same adventure. You pick from any of the four fascinating villains, and the adventurers choose a building in which to escape. Replay value is key.
You want content. This adventure has four villain choices, each of which has two forms. And you can fight them in the apothecary, subway station, opera house, or one of the other fully mapped out buildings.

208824.name: Boulder Dash - 30th Anniversary
208824.description:
Boulder Dash - 30th Anniversary features classic retro-style gameplay with 220 exciting levels across 11 new, gorgeous and unique worlds, and 10 playable characters. The new level editor and Steam Workshop support offers potentially infinite replay with both user as well as community-created levels.

Source: The Developer Website.

208825.name: Winter Eternal: Son of the Hungry Moon
208825.description:
From publisher blurb:

The remains of several animals are found in one of Emerald Rest’s most privileged districts and a team of investigators has been hired to find the cause.

This is the fourth One Sheet Adventure for Winter Eternal. The zip file includes the adventure, two maps and 6 pre-gen characters to use.

208826.name: Conga Master
208826.description:
The dance floor fills, the line gets longer… come on down, it's time to conga! Shake your virtual hips to the arcade action of Conga Master, fight to make the longest conga line possible and become the king of the club. No rhythm required – anyone can conga!

Source: The Game Website.

208827.name: Escape The Past
208827.description:
Stuck on this island, you have only one thing in your mind... Escape ! It's time for you to uncover the secrets of your life. Fight what you created and accept its consequences. Are you ready to escape your past ? In this new escape game, try to solve all the enigmas through several oneiric landscapes.

Source: The Developer Website.

208828.name: Brawlderdash
208828.description:
User Summary

Brawlderdash is a sports game.

208829.name: Dots eXtreme
208829.description:
Dots eXtreme is a classic dots puzzle with large boards and increased difficulty level. Connect matching colors and shapes in the new dots puzzle with board size up to 20x20.

Source: The Developer Website.

208830.name: NBA 2K17
videogamehonor: 2016 Gamescom Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Gamescom Best Simulation Game of the Year Winner
2016 Gamescom Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Sports/Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2017 SXSW Best Convergent Game of the Year Nominee
208830.description:
NBA 2K17, like the previous games in the series, is based on the sport of basketball; more specifically, it simulates the experience of the National Basketball Association (NBA). Several game modes are included, such as MyCareer, where the player creates a customizable player and plays through their career, MyGM and MyLeague, both franchise modes where the player controls an entire organization, and MyTeam, where the player creates a team to compete against other players' teams. Along with current NBA teams, other teams are included, such as national teams and EuroLeague teams.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NBA_2K17 NBA 2K17]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

208831.name: GrottZine (Nr 1 - Aug 2013)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208831.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Äntligen här! Det har länge funnits ett sug efter ett svenskt Old Schoolfansin. Detta 16-sidiga häfte är just precis det. GrottZine föddes ur konventet Grottröj, som sedan det startades visat att det finns ett glödande intresse för dåtidens rollspel både nu och framöver.

Förhoppningen är att hädanefter komma ut med ett läsvärt nummer per Grottröj – fyra nummer per år. Med det målet i sikte går vi ut hårt redan från början.

Vi vet att ni vill ha tips och tricks, någon dungeon, recensioner och gärna slumptabeller och komponenter att sätta in i de dungeons och äventyr ni bygger själva. Det levererar vi, och lite till.

Kolla in vår hemsida för information om hur du som läsare kan bidra till nästa nummer!

English Translation (provided via Google Translate)

Finally here! There has long been a demand for a Swedish Old School fanzine. This 16-page booklet is precisely just that. GrottZine born out Grottröj Convention, which since its launch has shown that there is a burning interest in the contemporary role play both now and in the future.

It is hoped that now come out with a readable numbers per Grottröj - four times a year. With that aim in mind, we go out hard from the start.

We know you want tips and tricks, a dungeon, trial and happy coincidence tables and components put into the dungeons and adventures you build themselves. There we deliver, and then some.

Check out our website for information on how readers can contribute to the next issue!

208832.name: GURPS Lite (3rd Edition)
208832.description:
From the publisher's website:

GURPS Lite Third Edition is a 32-page distillation of the basic GURPS Third Edition rules. It covers the essentials of character creation, combat, success rolls, magic, adventuring, and game mastering.

The purpose of GURPS Lite is to help GMs bring new players into the game, without frightening them with the Basic Set, Compendiums, and a stack of worldbooks! With GURPS Lite, you can show your players just how simple the GURPS system really is.

It can also be used as a neophyte's stand-alone introduction to roleplaying . . . but it is really designed as a tool to let the experienced player bring his friends into the game.

208833.name: Masks: A New Generation
208833.description:
From the Back Cover:

A giant robot is smashing down Main Street. Your best friend tried to kiss you. Your mom thinks your grades need work. Your mentor thinks your team is bringing you down. Oh, and your costume is ripped.

Just another day in Halcyon City...

Masks: A New Generation is a superhero roleplaying game in which a team of young heroes fights villains, saves lives, and tried to figure out who they are—noble paragons? Dark avengers? Or regular kids? All against the backdrop of Halcyon City, the greatest city in the world.

In this book, you get:


Ten playbooks for young superheroes, so you can create your own awesome characters
Rules for superheroic action, interpersonal drama, and changing identity
Detailed instructions for running the game, building villains, and playing to find out what happens
Tools for creating your own custom material for Masks
Masks makes use of the same rules-light engine as Apocalypse World, Monsterhearts, Dungeon World, Urban Shadows, and Epyllion to create stories about young superheroes in the vein of Young Justice, Young Avengers, and Teen Titans.


So what're you waiting for, hero? Time to get to work.

208834.name: Genetic Species
208834.description:
User Summary

A First Person Shooter for the Amiga, in which you play a member of a rebel organisation fighting against corporations that control the Earth. The Moon has exploded, and you're sent to investigate why. The most unique feature of the game is the ability to take control of NPCs and enemies, each with different strengths and weaponry.

208835.name: Diceball
208835.description:
This rare 1937 game from obscure publisher Ray-Fair Company uses two special dice to generate its results. Both are six-sided, but are marked with specific results, each with a line and number underneath. The rules say the dice are designed to "give results almost IDENTICAL with the averages of corresponding plays in REAL BASEBALL."

The game's dice, rules and red and blue wooden player tokens came in a small box with a separate 19" square board.

208836.name: Championship Game of Football
208836.description:
This pocket-size wartime football game consists of a block of wood less than 5" a side that is wrapped in simulated leather. Included in a cardboard drawer in theblock are an unusual 48-space spinner, four wooden pegs and a rules sheet with results table. The board has 100 holes on the field punched diagonally between each printed 10-yard division on the field. There also are holes to mark "Yards to Gain" (1-10) and downs (1-4).

The results table is laid out in columns. The first two columns handle kick-offs and returns. The remaining six are the play call options for the offensive player: Line Plunge; End Run; Trick Play; Forward Pass; Lateral Pass; and Punt.

There are 48 rows of results, each indicating the yards gained or lost on the called play according to the result on the spinner. Field goals may be attempted within 30 yards, and succeed on spins of 1 or multiples of 5; points after touchdown score on an even number.

208837.name: Duelo: Kung-fu
208837.description:
The Kung Fu master of his temple is aging. His movements are not as fast as before and he's increasingly tired. He realizes that he will not be around much longer, and is in a hurry to choose his successor. You are one of the most prepared candidates to be the next master, but this task will not be easy because there can only be one master. There will be several duels ahead ...

In Duelo: Kung Fu, players are masters of various martial arts styles invited to the big tournament that will determine who will be the new Master of Kung-Fu. To win the tournament, you should eliminate your opponents by knockout competition or winning more duels than them when the time is up.

On your turn, you can choose to fight with one of your opponents or reflect to better prepare for a future duel.
If you opt for reflection, play the card face up and use the first effect. If you choose the combat, play a card face down and choose an opponent. That player must place a card from his hand face down and then both are revealed. Activate the second effect of the card. Who ever has the greater focus(the number on top left) wins the duel. The winner draws a card as a prize and puts the defeated card in his victory pile.

Each style has its strengths and weaknesses. Explore them to be the winner!

208839.name: The Whispering Cairn
208839.description:
Age of Worms Adventure Path Conversion Guide

User summary:

This item converts The Whispering Cairn from Dungeon (Issue 124 - Jul 2005) for use with Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition). Note the original article is required to use this conversion guide.

208840.name: Death's Hangover
208840.description:
Death's Hangover is a ball and bat game, featuring horror elements, mature comedy and themes.

Source: The Game Website.

208841.name: Anno 2000
208841.description:
This gorgeous French game reeks of mid-20th Century science fiction imagery and optimism. While undated, the rules begin: "According to the latest scientific research, it will be possible at the latest in about 50 years, to voyage to the Moon, to other planets and even to stars much further away."

Underneath the beautiful artwork, it is a roll-and-move game, but with one twist. Up to four players try to move their rocket ships from Earth around the board and home. But another player controls the fearsome Robot, who starts somewhere on a separate network of lines between stars.

The Robot network and player track intersect at various points, and if the Robot can land exactly on top of a rocket, that player is out of the game. If all rocket ships are killed, the Robot player wins.

Nowhere on the box or board is there any indication of the artist, designer or publisher, or even a copyright or patent claim. The notation "Fr 3185" is printed at the bottom of the rules inside the box.

208842.name: Suel Imperium: Age of Glory
208842.description:
From the introduction:

A large book, known as Slerotin's Manifesto, had been venerated within the Onnwal temple of Wee Jas. During the Scarlet Brotherhood's occupation of Onnwal they obtained this prize. After recovery of the troll-skinned book, it was studied carefully by the Brotherhood in the closed city of Heseul Ilshar.

The book was found to contain many powerful spells, but more important to the Brotherhood were the history and details of the ancient Suel Empire. After reading two sections that told of an ancient relic "The Darkness That Holds All Shadows" and a powerful magical portal "The Null", the Brotherhood decided to send an expedition into the Sea of Dust.

The Brotherhood's expeditions were costly in terms of loss of life. The Yeomanry spies who closely watched the Brotherhood's local activities reported what little they could determine about these forays. While the Yeomanry does not know the details of their plans, they are correct to be worried. The Brotherhood plans to travel back in time using the Null, and once there steal the cubic relic from Xodast's treasure vault.

User summary:

For 5th - 8th level characters. A high-resolution map ("The Ancient Suel Basin") also was provided as a separate 1-page PDF file.

208844.name: The Soul Husks Caverns
208844.description:
User summary:

The world is threatened with a ritual of destruction. The characters must infiltrate The Soul Husks Caverns and destroy a husk to, possibly, disrupt the ritual.

This fan-created scenario is intended as the culmination of a fan-proposed "Iuz Campaign" beginning with T1-4: The Temple of Elemental Evil, continuing with S4: The Lost Caverns of Tsojcanth, and concluding with this adventure.

The scenario is intended for an experienced game master and assumes familiarity with the mentioned commercial products. It is designed for high-level characters. The scenario was provided as a ZIP archive containing:

- The Soul Husks Caverns (35-page PDF; the scenario)
- Maps (4-page PDF; scenario maps)
- NPCs (5-page PDF; NPC detailed builds)

208845.name: Greenreach
208845.description:
Author's blurb:

A post-Greyhawk Wars adventure, set in Panshazek's tower in the town of Greenreach near the edge of the Vesve forest, this high-level fan module will see the PC's tackling one of Iuz's Lesser Bonehearts - the cleric Panshazek and his personal forces.

User summary:

This fan-created scenario is for an experienced game master and assumes familiarity with the Greyhawk setting. It is designed for 8th - 10th level characters. The scenario as provided does not include a map.

208846.name: Delvenbrass
208846.description:
Author's blurb:

Explore the massive ruins of Delvenbrass and prevent the followers of Nerull from finding what they seek in its depths.

User summary:

This fan-created scenario is for an experienced game master and assumes familiarity with the Greyhawk setting. It presents a ten-level dungeon and is designed for 14th+ level characters. The scenario is provided as a ZIP archive that contains the following files:

- Delvenbrass (57-page DOC file; scenario)
- NPCs (28-page DOC file; NPC detailed builds)
- Eleven JPG files (scenario maps)

208847.name: Admundfort
208847.description:
Author's blurb:

A major lieutenant of Iuz wants to defect. Can the party trust him long enough to see him to safety?

User summary:

This fan-created scenario is for an experienced game master and assumes familiarity with the Greyhawk setting. It is designed for 9th - 11th level characters. A scenario map is not provided with the adventure.

208848.name: Dimensions Lost (d20)
208848.description:
Author's blurb:

Secreted away in the Yatils lies the ruins of another recently unearthed temple of Tharizdun. New converts vie for favor from their god by abducting the local gnomes. The adventure begins when the PC's enter the Gnomish Vale. At which time they will be summoned to a private meeting with Laird Gwaylar.

User summary:

For 2nd - 10th level characters (requires encounter adjustments).

208849.name: Gibbering Gate
208849.description:
Author's blurb:

Explore this terrifying citadel of insanity - the most dreaded prison in the Flanaess.

User summary:

For 9th - 11th level characters. The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing these files:

- Gibbering Gate (11-page PDF; scenario)
- NPCs (6-page PDF; detailed NPC builds)
- Maps (4-page PDF; scenario maps)

208850.name: Grabford Forces
208850.description:
Author's blurb:

The goal of this adventure is for the party to infiltrate the city of Grabford, and more specifically the castle, and take out Iuz’s leader, Maskaleyne, a member of the Lesser Bonehart, before the larger battle force invades the city itself. The easiest way to begin this adventure is to offer the job to them via a proxy of King Belvor, most likely Ereland Manneth. This can be done at a planning session in the town of Fendrelan that the PC’s are invited to. They were requested to join this meeting so that they can help in the planning of the attack on Grabford.

User summary:

For 9th - 11th level characters. The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing these files:

- Grabford Forces (21-page RTF; scenario)
- NPCs (5-page PDF; detailed NPC builds)
- Maps (3-page PDF; scenario maps)

208851.name: Ypsilonie: Cesta do vyjmenované země
208851.description: Ypsilonie: Cesta do vyjmenované země is an accessible light family game about an expedition to a magical kingdom. The game is mainly roll and move while trying to teach children(as well as adults) a little bit about czech grammar rules. The game is one big adventure (cca 50 minutes playing time) and three mini games (each around 25 minutes).

208852.name: Torchlight Mobile
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
208852.description:
User Summary

Torchlight Mobile is a fantasy game.

208853.name: When the Levee Breaks
208853.description:
Each player is a City Planner in New Orleans. All players must begrudgingly work together building levees to keep the city from flooding during the next big storm. During a turn, one player will be designated as the City Manager and select 3 levees for the City Planners to bid on. The levee that gets the most money, will be built. Unfortunately everyone has a different vision of the city's future and wants some districts to be destroyed for future revitalization.

In this semi-cooperative game, players will make and break promises to save and destroy the districts according to their secret goals. The game ends when the great storm comes and floods the unprotected districts. Players earn points for successfully fulfilling the their secret goals, and lose points for failure.

208854.name: GrottZine (Nr 2 - Nov 2014)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208854.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Nu börjar jag förstå vad det innebär att vara redaktör. Det är lite som att lägga pussel, fast man får inte ett pussel med färdigt motiv utan ett gäng bitar i olika storlek med olika motiv som ska passas in i en ram. Helst på en bestämd tid också. Tur att problemlösning och kreativitet är det som är roligast med den här hobbyn.
Detta pussel blev några artiklar och en slumptabell. Och kolla in den läckra tuppiraten som Jim Magnusson ritat! Läs mer om dem i det här numrets dungeon.

English Translation (via Google Translate)

Now I begin to understand what it means to be an editor. It's a bit like a jigsaw puzzle, though you may not finish a puzzle with subjects without a bunch of pieces in different sizes with different motifs to be fitted into a frame. Preferably in a particular time too. Luckily problem solving and creativity, it is most fun with this hobby.
This puzzle was a few articles and a random table. And check out the delicious tuppiraten Jim Magnusson drawn! Read more about them in this issue's dungeon.

208855.name: Molag Forces: The Heirarch's Palace
208855.description:
Author's blurb:

The party is commissioned to rescue precious artifacts from the Shield Lands on behalf of the Count of Crystalreach. To do so will require them to enter the halls of Molag itself.

User summary:

For 10th - 13th level characters. The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing these files:

- Molag Forces (12-page PDF; scenario)
- NPCs (3-page PDF; detailed NPC builds)
- Maps (3-page PDF; scenario maps)

208856.name: Darkrock Ventures: Expansion Pack #1
208856.description:
Darkrock Ventures: Expansion Pack #1 includes ten new cards to enhance your Darkrock Ventures experience!

Contains ten brand new, unique cards to add to your Darkrock Ventures base game:

5 New Research Cards
5 New Corporate Sponsors card
1 Proof of Purchase card (not used in gameplay)

208857.name: GrottZine (Nr 3 - Feb 2015)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208857.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Välkommen till det tredje numret av Sveriges bästa Old School-fansin! Det här numret har en tydlig klang av illustration och gör-det-själv. Dels bekantar vi oss med illustratörerna Jim och Martin (som gjort bilden nedan) som på olika sätt är inspirerade av eller inblandade i Old Schoolrörelsen, och dels bjuder vi på en guide i hur man gör en schysst dungeonkarta om man är lite mindre konstnärligt lagd. Naturligtvis har vi också med ett äventyr, som sig bör.

English Translation (via Google Translate):

Welcome to the third number of the best old school fansin! This number has a distinct connotation of illustration and do-it-yourself. Secondly you get acquainted with illustrators Jim and Martin (who made the picture below) who in various ways are inspired by or involved in the Old School Movement, and also we offer a guide on how to make a cool dungeon map if you are a little less artistically inclined. Of course, we are also an adventure, as it should be.

208858.name: GrottZine (Nr 4 - May 2015)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208858.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Fjärde numret av GrottZine!

Numret bjuder bland annat på en exposé om illustratören Björn Ramsten, del 1 av äventyret Zyhokochevs krypta och fem förunderliga artefakter.

English Translation (via Google Translate):

The fourth edition of GrottZine!

This number offers, among other things on an expose about the illustrator Björn Ramsten, Part 1 of the adventure Zyhokochevs crypt and five marvelous artifacts.

208859.name: Dimensions Lost
208859.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure takes place in a recently unearthed temple of Tharizdun trying to garner some favor from their god by abducting the local gnomes. The cult has secreted itself below and continues its raid on the gnomes, but now the heroes have been dispatched to arrived in time to rescue the enslaved denizens of the Gnomish Vale, and escort them home from the bastion of evil. The adventure begins when the PC's enter the Gnomish Vale. At which time they will be summoned to a private meeting with Laird Gwaylar.

User summary:

For 5th - 7th level characters. This is an adaptation of Dimensions Lost (d20), retrofitted for an earlier game version and with standardized formatting.

208860.name: Icewind Dale: Enhanced Edition
208860.description:
In the northernmost reaches of the Forgotten Realms lies the region of icy tundra known as Icewind Dale. Journey deep into the Spine of the World mountains, a harsh and unforgiving territory settled by only the hardiest folk. Beneath the carven glaciers and mountainsides, you must confront an evil that schemes to wreak destruction upon the face of Faerûn. This is the world of Icewind Dale: Enhanced Edition.

Originally released in 2000, Icewind Dale is a Dungeons & Dragons game set in Wizards of The Coast's legendary Forgotten Realms. This Enhanced Edition allows players to experience the epic adventure on PC, Mac, Linux, iPad, iPhone, and Android tablets and phones, and includes a host of new features:

Swords and Sorcery: Discover dozens of new spells and items, including new magic armor and weapons.
Blackguards and Wizard Slayers: Select from over 30 new kits and classes to create the perfect adventuring party.
Bring A Friend: Join your fellow adventurers in cooperative, cross-platform multiplayer games.
See The Unseen: Explore quest content cut from the original game, now finished and restored.
More to Experience: Icewind Dale: Enhanced Edition includes both the Heart of Winter and Trials of the Luremaster expansion packs.

Source: The Game Website.


In addition to being written in a different engine (by Beamdog) from "Icewind Dale + Heart of Winter + Trials of the Luremaster" it adds content that was cut from the original, multiplayer support, equipment, classes and class kits from the enhanced version of Baldur's Gate and various other game enhancements and ingame utilities.

208861.name: Baldur's Gate: Siege of Dragonspear
208861.description:
The threat of war looms over the city of Baldur's Gate. A crusade marches from the north, seizing supplies, forcing locals into military service, and disrupting trade along the Sword Coast. A charismatic warrior known as the Shining Lady leads this army, her background shrouded in mystery. Rumors whisper that she follows a divine agenda. Could the gods truly guide this Shining Lady?

The farther you travel from the city, the more you realize how many forces have a stake in the outcome of this conflict. Baldur's Gate has put its faith in you, but you must determine whose interests you truly serve before you face the Shining Lady among the ruins of Dragonspear Castle...

Expand Your Story: Continue the adventure in Baldur’s Gate II: Enhanced Edition after completing Siege of Dragonspear
The Crusade Rises: A sharp and subtle adventure that pits you against an enigmatic new foe
Explore the Sword Coast: Venture through vibrant new regions of the Sword Coast, with an area greater than Tales of the Sword Coast and Throne of Bhaal put together!
Gather Your Party: The original cast returns to kick butt for goodness - along with Neera, Rasaad, Dorn, and four new additions!
Double the Items: Over 100 new items—almost double the number than in all other enhanced editions combined
Extra Class: First new player class in over fifteen years: the spirit-calling shaman!
Venture Forth With A Friend: Cross-platform multiplayer on all supported platforms
Story Mode: A difficulty setting to allow players to experience all of the story with none of the Game Over screens
Legacy of Bhaal Mode: A difficulty setting offering tactical challenges only the most skilled of players can hope to defeat

208862.name: GrottZine (Nr 5 - Aug 2015)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208862.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Grottröj har vid det här laget blivit ett positivt återkommande inslag i hobbyn. Vid flera tillfällen har nybörjare till rollspel i allmänhet och Old School i synnerhet blivit introducerade till det genom Grottröj, så vitt jag vet med bra erfarenheter. För oss arrangörer känns det alltid positivt och lite nervöst när nya personer hör av sig och vill vara med. Pressen blir alltid lite högre när man ska ordna någons helt första spelpass.

Nya spelare är silver, men nya spelledare är guld! Något framtida nummer av GrottZine skulle vi vilja viga åt artiklar tillägnade dem som vill prova att axla spelledarmanteln för första gången. För att det ska bli så bra som möjligt så vill vi höra om Dina erfarenheter. Hur började du spelleda? Vad tycker du är svårt och skrämmande? Har du velat spelleda men håller dig ifrån det? Vi vill höra från dig! Mejla till bjorn.warmedal@gmail.com och berätta, så gör vi nästa nummer värdefullt för just dig.

English Translation (via Google Translate):

Grottröj has by now become a positive recurring feature in the hobby. On several occasions, beginners to role-playing games in general and Old School, in particular, been introduced to it by Grottröj, as far as I know with good experiences. For us, the organizers, it always feels positive and a little nervous when new people in touch and want to be with. The press is always a little higher when to arrange for someone completely first gaming session.

New players are silver, but the new game leader's gold! Any future issues of GrottZine we would like to perpetuate the articles dedicated to those who want to try to assume leadership mantle game for the first time. For it to be as good as possible, we want to hear about your experiences. How did you lead the game? What do you think is difficult and scary? Have you wanted to play lead, but keeps you from it? We want to hear from you! Email to bjorn.warmedal@gmail.com and tell us, we will do the next issue valuable to you.

208863.name: GrottZine (Nr 6 - Nov 2015)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208863.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Sjätte numret av Sveriges bästa old-school-fansin är här.

Det här är första gången vi försöker oss på ett temanummer, så luta dig tillbaka och dyk ner i genren Sword & Planet, med allt vad den har att erbjuda!

English Translation (via Googe Translate):

Sixth number of the best old-school fansin are here.

This is the first time we try to us in a special issue, so sit back and dive into the genre Sword & Planet, with all it has to offer!

208864.name: Sacklewood: To Capture a Troll
208864.description:
From the introduction:

A strange humanoid creature has been discovered lurking in the Suss Forest. The nearby village wants it dead; your employer wants it alive. Do you have the courage to capture a troll?

User summary:

For 4th - 6th level characters.

208865.name: The Forgotten Hero
208865.description:
From the introduction:

A strange humanoid creature has been discovered lurking in the Suss Forest. The nearby village wants it dead; your employer wants it alive. Do you have the courage to capture a troll?

User summary:

For 5th - 7th level characters.

208866.name: Greyhawk Lairs
208866.description:
From the introduction:

A Collection of Short Adventures in the Flanaess for All Levels of Play.

Includes:

- Pursuit at the Edge of the Crystalmists
- The Haunted Mines of Blackstone
- Quest for Pain's Memory
- Defection
- Brindec
- Oerthly Encounters
- And several short events

208867.name: Bandits!
208867.description:
From the introduction:

Bandits - the soldiers of the See of Medegia have long kept such rabble away from the towns and villages of the provinces, but chaos is rising everywhere. His equitable nemesis, Spidasa, the Holy Censor of Medegia, has issued a proclamation of bounty on those poor fools who dare hinder the wayfarers on his roads!

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

208869.name: Alestone
208869.description:
A strategy board game of thinking and drinking. This game plays on an old world tavern theme where you try to capture an opponents glass of ale using a set of stone game pieces. The players can utilize augments such as the sword, shield, horse, and war ram in order to gain an advantage.

On your turn you may move any two stones up to a number of spaces equal to that particular stones designation. The Fate stone's maximum movement is determined by rolling 1d6 at the start of each of the players turn. Once two stones have been moved, play moves clockwise among the players.

On their turn a player can attack an opponents stone, sending it back across the board to it's starting position within it's stockade. However, this causes the attacking stone to become knocked prone and vulnerable to being pinned by an opponent moving on top. The pinned stoned cannot move until the start of a turn where it is not longer pinned.

Using augments such as the horse or the shield gives you a bonus to movement or defending against attacks, receptively. Use of the war ram and sword give offensive bonuses.

The game ends once a players moves three of his five stones into the stockade of an opponent, effectively capturing his glass of ale and winning the game.

The game incorporates optional rules for playing with your favorite beverage.

208870.name: Infinem Quickstart/Demo
208870.description:
(publisher blurb)

The End has come, Humanity has fallen and the survivors fight to live each and every day. Most People have congregated into massive walled cities called Beacons for safety.

A race of squid-faced beings called the Ancient Ones have risen from the depths of the Earth and now seek to claim the planet for themselves. Their ancient enemy the Angelics are here as well but they seem to only be watching for now.

You are a hero, you trek outside the safety of the Beacons for wealth, adventure and survival.

As the human race teeters on the edge of extinction, will you be the hero that saves us all?

208871.description:
This is a 'car' promo token for the game Dream Home. The first player to complete a two-card garage receives the 'car' promo token, which is worth 1 point.

The promo token is treated as every other furnishing token.
208871.name: Domek: Promo Token – Car

208872.name: Folktale
208872.description:
(publisher blurb)

Folktale is a simple role playing system for having adventures that really feel like stories.
It is perfect for fairy tales, heroic myths, humorous tall tales, and horrific urban legends.

It can be explained in minutes and played with no preparation, all you need are a few six sided dice and some imagination!

Easy to learn and easy to play, Folktale is ideal for families, children, friends, drunk people, and pretty much anyone with an imagination, love of stories, and eagerness to have fun!

208875.name: Far From Noise
videogamehonor: 2017 IGF Awards (Nuovo) Best Innovation of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Honorable Mention
2017 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
208875.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.





Far from Noise is a single-player narrative set on the edge of a cliff overlooking a vast ocean.
​
You are a 20 year-old woman stuck, balanced precariously over the edge of a cliff in an old rusting car. The sun is gradually disappearing behind the horizon and the blanket of night will soon fall. Through a strange conversation you can attempt to discover your reasons for coming out there, your relationship with nature and if you'll make it out alive. Source: The Developer Website.

208876.name: Morgansfort: The Western Lands Campaign
208876.description:
From publisher description:

Morgansfort, The Western Lands Campaign, contains 3 different dungeon based adventures and a small campaign setting.
