It also includes a detailed home base, Morgansfort, for your heroes to begin their adventures in! This module includes new Heroes & Other Worlds rules for using holy symbols to repel...or unholy symbols to control the undead! This campaign module is suitable for a new or experienced Referee and Players. Based on the original adventure by Chris Gonnerman

208877.name: GrottZine (Nr 7 - Feb 2016)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
208877.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Det här är det första (och kanske enda) temanumret, med tema Sword & Planet! En perfekt introduktion till denna eminenta genre, med mycket både matnyttigt och underhållande innehåll.

Beställ enligt sedvanlig metod innan det är för sent!

English Translation (via Google Translate):

This is the first (and perhaps only) special issue, with the theme Sword & Planet! A perfect introduction to this eminent genre, both with very useful information and entertaining content.

Order by a conventional method before it is too late!

208879.name: Dead Boarder
208879.description:
From the introduction to the one-hour version:

This is the first in a series of demonstration scenarios meant to introduce new players to the fun of Call of Cthulhu gaming. The scenario is designed to take approximately 45 to 60 minutes in total—just long enough for a taster of the game.

Where necessary, specific examples of rules at various points in the story are referenced. . . . Advice on moving the story forward is also provided. The scenario is written to ensure that all players, no matter who is running the game, have a very consistent play experience.

While intended as a convention style taster game, you are free to use the story as a jumping off point for a longer game.


From the introduction to the extended version:

This is an extended version of our popular one-hour demo scenario, designed to introduce new players to the fun of Call of Cthulhu gaming. The scenario’s normal one-hour time limit has been removed and up to six-players can be accommodated to provide everyone with a taster of the game.

208880.name: Lost Crew
208880.description:
Lost Crew - this is a story of survival of the astronauts on the orbital station that is lost in time.

The game is a quest messenger, in which the player will communicate with the inhabitants of the space station, helping them to survive in difficult situations, and even science fiction. Each replica of a character the player will have up to four possible answers, the story itself is not linear, the game is tuned to replay the frequent accumulation of certain key knowledge that will eventually open up new possibilities and the story branches.

All the action takes place in real time, but the player has an infinite time accelerator, with which he can always cut expectation.

At the end of the game the player is waiting for one of the 32 options for the finals.

Source: The Developer Website.

208881.description:
A book with 200 printed Trivial Pursuit cards, offering 1200 questions and answers from the following categories:

Jazz, Blues & Big Band
Popular Music
Rock
Folk & Country
Classical, Opera & Ballet
Popular Lyrics
208881.name: Trivial Pursuit Questions: Music Edition

208882.description:
A book containing questions for use with Trivial Pursuit in the following categories:

Geography
Entertainment
History
Art & Literature
Science & Nature
Sport & Leisure
208882.name: Trivial Pursuit Questions: 1200 Brand New Questions and Answers

208883.name: Bakumatsu Gettan Fuda
208883.description: This is a set collection game using a deck of cards with historical figures who played important roles in the Bakumatsu period (1853-1867) on them (these cards also serve as a standard deck of cards). Each player is dealt five cards. On their turn, the player draws one card and discards one card face up in front of them, trying to build one of 43 sets, which are thematic (people from the same domain, people involved in the same incidents, etc.), require 2 to 5 cards, and are rated from one to fifty points. When a player is one card away from completing his or her set, they say "Iza! Jinjo ni!" (Roughly, "Let's fight properly), and discard their card sideways. If they see the last card they need in front of another player, they may take it and finish their set. When a player finishes their set, they say "Bakumatsu," and discard their last card. They are done. The game ends when the deck runs out, at which time the sets are scored, highest score wins and deals the next game.

208885.name: Hexus
208885.description:
The first game that combines both puzzles and a town-building strategy, the mixture that creates the unforgettable atmosphere of Ancient Egypt.

A player will have to find 10 legendary ancient artifacts.
To make a go of it the player should get through 120 unique game-levels – puzzles and 15 different mini-games.

Source: The Developer Website.

208886.name: Synchropipes
208886.description:
In Synchropipes players are building a pipes network trying to fit every tile in their boards and connecting the most outer pipes possible.

At the beginning of a game each player receives an identical set of 32 tiles. One player is chosen to be the leader. The leader takes 8 of his tiles at random and put them to the box. They will not be used in the game. Every other player now place all the tiles in a visible manner so that every specific tile can be found and taken easily.

In each round the leader takes one of his tiles at random and annouces the tile to the other players. Now each other player look for and take the identical tile from their sets. Now all players including the leader have to place that tile on their board.

Every tile features two kind of pipes. Thin and thick. A thin pipe has two be connected with other thin pipes and thick with other thick. However the central starting pipe and the outer pipes are universal, they can be connected with every pipe.

The players has to start placing tile from the central pipe and so on to the one already placed. If a player cannot make a legal move she has to place a tile face-down. That tile will score -1 point at the end of the game.

The goal of the game is to connect as much outer pipes as possible and have the least possible amount of face-down tiles. Each outer pipe features bonus points that are granted for connection.

The game ends after 24th turn when all players have their board full of tiles. The player who scored most points is the winner.

208887.description:
French Wars of Religion - Volume 2
Ivry 1590
Marc’hallac’h 1591
Craon 1592

- Ivry 1590
March 1590, Paris has been under siege for a year by Henry IV and is on the brink of famine. To increase the pressure on Paris and Normandy, Henry IV lays siege to Evreux as well. The Duke of Mayenne, lieutenant general of the kingdom of France for the League, decides to go meet the Royalist army.
The clash occurs on the great prairie of Ivry where the king makes his famous speech about his white panache during the charge against Egmont’s Spanish lancers.

- Marc’hallac’h 1591
After the entry into the League of the governor of Brittany, Philippe de Mercœur, Henry IV replaces him with the Prince of Dombes. But he is unable to drive out Mercœur and prompts a muddled situation with neither side holding a clear advantage. Things seemed to change with the arrival of 7000 Spaniards for the League and 2400 British for the Royalists. During 1591, the Royalist army and that of the League would have several occasions to come undone as on the Marc’hallac’h...

- Craon 1592
Early 1592, the majority of Brittany is in the hands of the League under the command of the Duke of Mercœur with the help of a large contingent of Spanish troops. To stop his progress, Henry IV asks the Prince of Dombes to seize the town of Craon at the intersection of Brittany, Anjou and Maine. He is joined in late April by the Prince of Conti’s troops.
On 22 May, Mercœur’s vanguard arrives in view of Craon and drives out the British outposts...
208887.name: Avec Infini Regret II

208888.name: Il Trono di Mortadella
208888.description:
Bologna, XIIIth century. The Empire, the Papacy and guilds of arts and crafts are the powers that govern the city, with its ancient university and its population of 60000, it is the fifth most populous city in Europe.

In these years, Bologna is the largest textile center of Italy and its complex network of channels provides energy to the silk industry by connecting the city with the rest of the land, from the river Po to the Adriatic Sea.

Bologna is a rich and cosmopolitan city where you eat well and drink even better, but it is also a city plagued by extreme social differences, political conspiracies, wars and plagues. In short, life is never boring!
Each player controls people and resources in order to claim the most important and coveted place of power in the city: “The Throne of Bologna”.
Claiming the Iron Throne would be a piece of cake in comparison. No weapons and no means are barred:will you be able to fulfill your goals and become the King of Bologna?

GAME GOALS
Each player takes a role in the fictional version of Bologna depicted in ”The Throne of Bologna”: to select their role, each player draws a Role card, which they must keep secret from the other players until the end of the game. Turn after turn players roll their dice to gain goods and resources or to unleash devastating effects against their rivals (or even upon themselves!): The game’s strategy depends on the role you are playing and on your own experience!

208889.name: I Racconti del Libro della Giungla
208889.description:
A racket wakes you up in the middle of the night! A lightning set a tree on fire: we have to stop it or it will burn to ashes the entire jungle.. How will you deal with it? Will you use sand or water to cover it or you will howl to the moon to ask your animal companions for help? Everything you will do to save your pack will be told for centuries as a legend to the young wolves around the Rock, during the long and wild jungle nights.

I Racconti del Libro della Giungla ("Tales from the Junglebook") is an innovative storytelling game thanks to the impartial scoring system. It has an engine made of 27 element cards as objects and moves. A few of these cards will be given to players and will be their hands.
During you turn you tell a story starting from a quest card incipit. You can mention 3 elements at most in your tale. If another player has the corresponding element card, he has to show it to take a point but help you gaining points at the end of the quest.
When you reach the story end throw a die and add to the result the number of element cards shown by other players. If the result is the same as the quest card's at least, you take points from the quest card.
Allies like Baloo and Bagheera and enemies like Jakala and Shere-Khan will give bonus and malus to the quest.

boardgameintegration: Movie Plotz
Movie Plotz
208890.description:
Movie Plotz: The Sequel is a standalone expansion to 2014's Movie Plotz. All new Movie Plotz cards!

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then draw cards to modify the movie concept. With each draw, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

The game lasts for approximately 15 minutes, until all cards have been played. Depending on the rules variation that you choose to play, the player with the most points will win.
208890.name: Movie Plotz: The Sequel

208891.description: Two promo cards were handed out at Gen Con 2016. One of the Republican presidential nominee and one of the Democratic presidential nominee. They are alternate art versions of the Reptilian Supreme Leader used with the Conspiracy! solitaire rules. They are not needed, but just to add flavor to that version.
208891.name: Conspiracy! Gen Con 2016 Promos

208892.name: RPS HEX
208892.description:
A turn-based strategy conquest game, RPS HEX pits you against the other Players in an attempt to conquer the entire playing field, which is actually created during the course of the game.
Each player will have a set of markers used to indicate ownership of the cards that they play during the game. Each player will also have a hand of 6 hex-shaped cards with 3 different possible symbols: Rock, Paper and Scissors, as well as up to 6 arrows, one for each side of the card.
Playing the cards seems simple enough, but it's in capturing the opponent's cards that really help you towards conquering the field. Play cards from your hand in an attempt to override your opponent's card and capture it by either pointing an arrow on your card to an empty side on your opponent's card or challenging the opponent's card by pointing an arrow on your card to another arrow on the opponent's card. Watch out, though; if you find yourself locked in a challenge against the wrong card, you could end up losing it all. You can potentially capture multiple cards at once. Certain special cards can completely turn the tide of the game in your favor. At the end of the game after all cards have been played from each Player's hands, the Player who owns the most cards on the field wins.

208893.name: Red7
208893.description:
A Game of Wits and Cunning

7 colors. 7 numbers. 49 cards and infinite ways to play.

In Red7, the goal is not to follow the rules, but to win. In order to do so, players who can't meet the standing requirement can change the rule and force their opponents to obey it. This simple twist makes Red7 as unpredictable and exciting as an action game, while preserving its deeply tactical essence.

Source: The Developer Website.

208894.name: Narcos
208894.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Narcos is a game that will allow you to play a part in the creation of the Medellin drug cartel. Travel with your associates along the road from Medellin to Miami, avoiding police controls to complete your job as smoothly as possible. For every failed delivery there’s someone who’ll pay and you’d better hope it’s not you. In NARCOS each player will have to play his role for everything to go as planned. But be warned, double crossers hide behind every corner an under cover cop could catch you red-handed, or worse, one of your associates might as well decide to cheat you.

Game preparation
Shuffle the character cards and distribute them face down ,one to each player. Each player will check the character he has been given and put the card in front of himself,careful to keep it face down all the time. Shuffle the Delivery deck and give 5 cards to each player. Put the deck in the middle of the game table in order to allow every player to easily reach it. Leave some free space for the discard pile.
At no time during the match should anyone ever reveal his character identity by any mean, not should anyone give details of the cards he has in his hands or those who have been given or received during the match. However, it is possible for the players to talk during the INTERROGATION phase to try saving their own neck and to avoid being eliminated.
Once every player has his own character and his own hand, you can continue to the next phase of the game.
END OF THE GAME:
The game ends when one of these conditions occurs:
Drug traffickers victory:
The DRUG TRAFFICKERS win if they manage to successfully complete the expected number of deliveries before the end of the turns (based on the numbers of players)
Or
The DRUG TRAFFICKERS win if they eliminate EVERY federal agent
Or
an individual DRUG TRAFFICKER can decide to starts his own business and win the match on his own(VICTORY BY MONOPOLY)
Federal agents victory:
FEDERAL AGENTS win if they manage to prevent the drug traffickers to successfully complete the expected number of deliveries.
Pablo Escobar victory:
PABLO ESCOBAR wins if during any delivery round he manages to obtain FOUR PARLAMENTARIAN cards AFTER haing passed the four cards of that turn to the player on his left side. Or PABLO ESCOBAR might also get a VICTORY BY MONOPOLY.

208895.description:
Game description from the publisher:

You've just been given a shot at being the head chef at the prestigious New York Slice pizza parlor. Now you and your fellow pizza chef wannabes have to make the most amazing pizzas...one slice at a time!

In New York Slice, each player slices pizzas into portions, giving their opponents first choice, while they take the leftovers. There are a dozen kinds of pizza to work with, from veggie to hawaiian to meat lover's, and each player decides if they want to eat or keep some of the slices, building the best collection of pizzas possible!

Each time a player slices a pizza, there's a different special to go along with it, whether it's allocated to one of the portions or placed on its own. Specials provide the player with special powers or points, such as calling dibs on a slice before the pizza is divided, getting one of the normally-out-of-the-game "mystery slices', having an opportunity to "sneak a slice" by moving it from one portion to another when they choose, and many more—there are 14 different "Today's Specials" in the game.

Some slices have anchovies on them (yuck!), which are worth negative points to anyone who collects them — but anchovies might show up on different pizza types you're collecting, so in order to have the majority of a type, you just might have to collect one with anchovies on it!

If you tie another player for the most slices of a type, neither of you gets any points — but a bunch of slices have two types of pizza on them, with each combo slice being worth half a slice of each type, which is great for breaking ties.

Most slices have pepperoni on them, which you can eat for points (instead of collecting to go for the majority of each slice type).
208895.name: New York Slice
